commit_message:
Adding XST test to syntribos

Adding cross site tracing test to syntribos. This vulnerability
can be exploited only if there are existing xss vulnerabilities
in the app.

Moving "checks" that deals specificially with header data to
"header" directory.

Change-Id: I7b4b40ca54a95628e9b6d55963b5e159e6862a45

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-01-17 17:32:58.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Setup a 2nd cell for the subnode in multinode setups

This creates a nova_subnode_cell database and subnode-cell

We have to move the call to 'nova-manage db sync' so that

commit_message:
Setup a 2nd cell for the subnode in multinode setups

This creates a nova_subnode_cell database and subnode-cell
cells v2 cell. This is done when setting up the nova,
nova_api and nova_cell0 databases on the primary node.

We have to move the call to 'nova-manage db sync' so that
it runs after the subnode cell is created so that it's database
schema is migrated along with the main (nova) and nova_cell0
databases.

This change is necessary for testing out a multi-cell deployment
with cells v2.

Change-Id: I6d263c81579f8c52dcf4cb9a0085c64545ee13e5
Depends-On: I4fb1c966e6e011b73d42a1629718abf1adc8125f

commit_message:
changed the ordering for the ceilometer services

This change simply moves the ceilometer collector service to the bottom
of the service list. This is being done due possible issues in the
order in which some services are started causing them to hang for
several minutes before continuing.

Change-Id: I9be50c32ac33bd86f14b8069e604fc4719237d51
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate the os-quota-class-sets API (spec)

This spec aims to both clarify and restrict the concept of quota classes in
Nova which really only work with the implicit 'default' quota class.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint deprecate-os-quota-class-sets

Change-Id: Iace67d320984adc9ec3a0e5897cfb131938dfe65

commit_message:
[10/xx] Implement mixin with common fields

This patch adds classes that hold fields common to many of the objects
Dragonflow's model defines. New models can use theses classes as extra
bases to augment their fields and functionality.

Partially-Implements: blueprint refactor-nb-api
Change-Id: I7ead9de47fe9fc4425044e8750200e867cf389a8

commit_message:
Skip gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4-.. jobs

gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4-scenario00X-tempest-centos-7-nv
jobs were not skipped even if the patches were not related to the code.
So the jobs wasted the gate resource, so this patch makes them skip when
proposing unrelated patches.
This issue was detected on I6f5c86778e9394ffa56bd11678f47d2939c7ab47

Change-Id: Ic6a7728d6789c37bb57ceea51b295050cd40d242

subject: Don't recalculate EndpointMap to get outputs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-27 12:18:40.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud.j2.yaml'], 'message': "Don't recalculate EndpointMap to get outputs

As of Ocata, whenever Heat needs to get the value of an output from a
nested Stack it will still load the Stack in memory and re-resolve the
output value. This means that the EndpointMap's endpoint_map output, which
is huge, gets loaded and recalculated whenever showing the EndpointMap or
KeystoneUrl outputs of the main (overcloud) stack. To avoid this, store the
value locally in an OS::Heat::Value resource. This means that the
EndpointMap will only be resolved once, during the stack create/update, and
the outputs can refer to that value.

Related-Bug: #1661728
Change-Id: Ia79eceeea309f5508713a310849f5d366a035430
Depends-On: If0f80cab94c28514d1569b1025362ab9d9d31512
(cherry picked from commit b2ee58c7f6883011b4ba8b387eedc63d3600aea0)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't recalculate EndpointMap to get outputs

As of Ocata, whenever Heat needs to get the value of an output from a
nested Stack it will still load the Stack in memory and re-resolve the
output value. This means that the EndpointMap's endpoint_map output, which
is huge, gets loaded and recalculated whenever showing the EndpointMap or
KeystoneUrl outputs of the main (overcloud) stack. To avoid this, store the
value locally in an OS::Heat::Value resource. This means that the
EndpointMap will only be resolved once, during the stack create/update, and
the outputs can refer to that value.

Related-Bug: #1661728
Change-Id: Ia79eceeea309f5508713a310849f5d366a035430
Depends-On: If0f80cab94c28514d1569b1025362ab9d9d31512
(cherry picked from commit b2ee58c7f6883011b4ba8b387eedc63d3600aea0)

commit_message:
Install openstack-heat-agents on upgrade

This package wasn't installed in the Newton image and we need to
install it during upgrade to be able to skip preupgrade validations.

Change-Id: If6ee7a3801756ac445ae35534803eab175ad8e40
Closes-Bug: 1667967
(cherry picked from commit 96618f85e6b92a4d1d2413e72adafab2abcbddc6)

commit_message:
bump dstools to 0.3.0

This includes a fix that ensures that setlc works correctly if the
local.conf file doesn't have a [[local|localrc]] section at all. That
was tripping up some existing 3rd party CI systems.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 06:29:55.000000000', 'files': ['inc/python'], 'message': 'Disable python3 deployment for swift

It's not gated on in swift gate, and there are obvious issues with py3
compatibility of their code. For example, I get the following error in
swift-proxy-server log file in neutron gate:

  File "/opt/stack/new/swift/swift/common/middleware/slo.py", line 799
    def is_small_segment((seg_dict, start_byte, end_byte)):
                         ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

This issue completely blocks neutron gate. I think it's fair to disable
swift special casing here until the project adds a py3 tempest job into
their gate.

Change-Id: Idd8f9698942a48b0cb18b30dcb5c3e75b1886975
Closes-Bug: #1667579
'}]
commit_message:
Disable python3 deployment for swift

It's not gated on in swift gate, and there are obvious issues with py3
compatibility of their code. For example, I get the following error in
swift-proxy-server log file in neutron gate:

  File "/opt/stack/new/swift/swift/common/middleware/slo.py", line 799
    def is_small_segment((seg_dict, start_byte, end_byte)):
                         ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

This issue completely blocks neutron gate. I think it's fair to disable
swift special casing here until the project adds a py3 tempest job into
their gate.

Change-Id: Idd8f9698942a48b0cb18b30dcb5c3e75b1886975
Closes-Bug: #1667579

commit_message:
Libvirt-Mockup: Turn off strict_slashes on all routes

This patch is turning off the default strict_slashes from Flask
globally. With that, the libvirt mockup won't return a 404 if there's a
trailing slash when routing the requests.

Change-Id: I4c7ba16fc2abfb53e70e38f1842889903ca2a5c4

subject: Change name of rbac_role_converter to rbac_policy_parser.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-26 20:22:09.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_auth.py', 'tests/test_rbac_policy_parser.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_policy_parser.py'], 'message': 'Change name of rbac_role_converter to rbac_policy_parser.

This patch simply changes the name of the file and class of
rbac_role_converter/RbacPolicyConverter to the more accurate
name of rbac_policy_parser/RbacPolicyParser, because no "conversion"
is actually performed; instead the policy file is parsed and the
contents of which are passed to oslo_policy, which if anything does
the actual conversion.

Also fixes a bug in the event that an Exception is caught
in rbac_policy_parser: when an Exception is thrown, `rule` is never
defined, resulting in a NameError in _try_rule. `rule` is changed
to `apply_rule` to resolve this.

Change-Id: I978c5134f8ab922b7fb3d9c901c936dee2f62f8b
'}]
commit_message:
Change name of rbac_role_converter to rbac_policy_parser.

This patch simply changes the name of the file and class of
rbac_role_converter/RbacPolicyConverter to the more accurate
name of rbac_policy_parser/RbacPolicyParser, because no "conversion"
is actually performed; instead the policy file is parsed and the
contents of which are passed to oslo_policy, which if anything does
the actual conversion.

Also fixes a bug in the event that an Exception is caught
in rbac_policy_parser: when an Exception is thrown, `rule` is never
defined, resulting in a NameError in _try_rule. `rule` is changed
to `apply_rule` to resolve this.

Change-Id: I978c5134f8ab922b7fb3d9c901c936dee2f62f8b

subject: DNM investigate libvirt networking failures
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-27 18:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/prepare_libvirt.yml'], 'message': "DNM investigate libvirt networking failures

The way the sporadic bug #1650025 manifests itself suggests that something
might go wrong on libvirt restart so that the bridge for the 'default'
network is being created but then the network is unable to move to
'active' state (normally, when the network is in 'inactive' state, bridge
is absent).

Trying to find root cause, get libvirt logs after restarting libvirt.
Also try explicit stop-start instead of single restart.

Change-Id: Ia5fe490c3f313a4d36d2cc4bd128b62bd480c2f3
Related-Bug: #1650025
"}]
commit_message:
DNM investigate libvirt networking failures

The way the sporadic bug #1650025 manifests itself suggests that something
might go wrong on libvirt restart so that the bridge for the 'default'
network is being created but then the network is unable to move to
'active' state (normally, when the network is in 'inactive' state, bridge
is absent).

Trying to find root cause, get libvirt logs after restarting libvirt.
Also try explicit stop-start instead of single restart.

Change-Id: Ia5fe490c3f313a4d36d2cc4bd128b62bd480c2f3
Related-Bug: #1650025

commit_message:
Add a script to create dashboard for gate

This is a script to create the gerrit dashboard url
for patches related to gate-failure, all you need is
to run this python file and it will output the url.

make sure libraries like launchpad.lib and gerrit-dash-creator
are installed, it will basically build a dash file and call
gerrit-dash-creator to generate the url.

Change-Id: I395b5882e17a540b4c5c514849774fd8336ad908

'swift/bin/swift_reconciler_enqueue.py', 'swift/bin/swift_account_audit.py'], 'message': 'Use pbr console_script entrypoints for bin/ scripts

This commit switches the install setup for the bin/ script to use pbr
console_script entrypoints. Letting pbr handle the actual script has a
number of advantages, but the primary motivator for this patch is to
have the shebang for installed binary be set at install time to the
version of python used to do the install. This is necessary as part of
the python 3 bring up.

To enable using the entrypoint the scripts need to be in the packaged
python names space and have a callable we can use for the entrypoint.
This involves moving the scripts from bin/ to swift/bin and changing
the file names so they can be imported. (ie change dashes to underscores
and add .py) Then adding a function, main(), in each file so we can have
the entrypoint call that function.

For backwards compatibility the old location of the scripts in the repo
are symlinked to the new files. So if anyone was directly calling them
from a local repo clone that will still work.

Change-Id: I11379636ee59331d4a06e207e3dc96d649eacf35
'}]
commit_message:
Use pbr console_script entrypoints for bin/ scripts

This commit switches the install setup for the bin/ script to use pbr
console_script entrypoints. Letting pbr handle the actual script has a
number of advantages, but the primary motivator for this patch is to
have the shebang for installed binary be set at install time to the
version of python used to do the install. This is necessary as part of
the python 3 bring up.

To enable using the entrypoint the scripts need to be in the packaged
python names space and have a callable we can use for the entrypoint.
This involves moving the scripts from bin/ to swift/bin and changing
the file names so they can be imported. (ie change dashes to underscores
and add .py) Then adding a function, main(), in each file so we can have
the entrypoint call that function.

For backwards compatibility the old location of the scripts in the repo
are symlinked to the new files. So if anyone was directly calling them
from a local repo clone that will still work.

Change-Id: I11379636ee59331d4a06e207e3dc96d649eacf35

subject: Restore configurability of container resolvers
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-20 18:17:17.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/container-resolv-host-match-c6e3760cf4a8e5cd.yaml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Restore configurability of container resolvers

In I66b448dee361e231d172eb278b290ec4dccfdf97 the option to configure
DNS resolvers for the LXC caches was removed, as the host's resolv.conf
began being copied into the container verbatim.

Then in Ib139af5221dbb1f479ca068e472cf0e8aa828a8d the implementation
was revised to instead generate (not copy) the resolver configuration
with a hard coded resolver address pointing over the LXC bridge toward
the host's dnsmasq installation.

In theory the result is the same as simply copying the resolv.conf
into the container from the hosts, but in some cases this is not true.
If a deployer has disabled the lxcbr0 functionality and does not use
the lxc net bridge, then a broken nameserver entry is inserted into
the /etc/resolv.conf pointing to a host that is not necessarily
reachable by the container.

In addition, the lxc net resolver setup is done over dhcp. In ubuntu
containers, dhcp resolvers served with the address lease are used by
resolvconf to rebuild /etc/resolv.conf, so if the dhcp interface does
not exist, resolvconf will create an empty /etc/resolv.conf file with
no nameservers configured at all.

This patch maintains the default functionality of configuring the
resolver configuration in the container pointing toward the physical
host's dnsmasq. In ubuntu, the template is fixed to drop this
configuration into resolvconf instead of modifying /etc/resolv.conf
directly. Additionally, the ability for deployers to override the
intended nameserver configuration is restored using the same variable
that existed before.

Change-Id: I63816d4b9ca836e47334aea3b9ccde514459de53
"}]
commit_message:
Restore configurability of container resolvers

In I66b448dee361e231d172eb278b290ec4dccfdf97 the option to configure
DNS resolvers for the LXC caches was removed, as the host's resolv.conf
began being copied into the container verbatim.

Then in Ib139af5221dbb1f479ca068e472cf0e8aa828a8d the implementation
was revised to instead generate (not copy) the resolver configuration
with a hard coded resolver address pointing over the LXC bridge toward
the host's dnsmasq installation.

In theory the result is the same as simply copying the resolv.conf
into the container from the hosts, but in some cases this is not true.
If a deployer has disabled the lxcbr0 functionality and does not use
the lxc net bridge, then a broken nameserver entry is inserted into
the /etc/resolv.conf pointing to a host that is not necessarily
reachable by the container.

In addition, the lxc net resolver setup is done over dhcp. In ubuntu
containers, dhcp resolvers served with the address lease are used by
resolvconf to rebuild /etc/resolv.conf, so if the dhcp interface does
not exist, resolvconf will create an empty /etc/resolv.conf file with
no nameservers configured at all.

This patch maintains the default functionality of configuring the
resolver configuration in the container pointing toward the physical
host's dnsmasq. In ubuntu, the template is fixed to drop this
configuration into resolvconf instead of modifying /etc/resolv.conf
directly. Additionally, the ability for deployers to override the
intended nameserver configuration is restored using the same variable
that existed before.

Change-Id: I63816d4b9ca836e47334aea3b9ccde514459de53

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-27 14:40:48.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Add a notifications topic for novajoin

Having novajoin use the default 'notifications' topic is problematic as
we get into race-conditions with the telemetry services, which consume
(and don't requeue) the notifications. For this reason, we decided to
start using a separate topic for novajoin, and make it start consuming
the notifications as well.

Change-Id: I50695654a8db75e5d1e3a240f552a1ce0d27c72d
"}]
commit_message:
Add a notifications topic for novajoin

Having novajoin use the default 'notifications' topic is problematic as
we get into race-conditions with the telemetry services, which consume
(and don't requeue) the notifications. For this reason, we decided to
start using a separate topic for novajoin, and make it start consuming
the notifications as well.

Change-Id: I50695654a8db75e5d1e3a240f552a1ce0d27c72d

Vector Packet Processing (VPP) is a high performance packet processing

commit_message:
Add VPP composable service

Vector Packet Processing (VPP) is a high performance packet processing
stack that runs in user space in Linux. VPP is used as an alternative to
kernel networking stack for accelerated network data path. This patch
adds VPP as a composable service. Note that NIC binding related configs
for VPP are handled in os-net-config.

Depends-on: I70a68a204a8b9d533fc2fa4fc33c39c3b1c366bf

Change-Id: I5e4b1903dc87cb16259eeb05db585678acadbc6b
Implements: blueprint fdio-integration-tripleo

subject: Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 18:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['templates/chrony.conf.j2'], 'message': "Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over
time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using
'bindcmdaddress' will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over
localhost only.  This should allow client functionality and
disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086
(cherry picked from commit 4cb2fa4eaa5a2b2d282f9292b1a19f79fcb5ebbb)
"}]
commit_message:
Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over
time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using
'bindcmdaddress' will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over
localhost only.  This should allow client functionality and
disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086
(cherry picked from commit 4cb2fa4eaa5a2b2d282f9292b1a19f79fcb5ebbb)

subject: Add OpenDaylightConnectionProtocol parameter to opendaylight-api service
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-16 20:07:34.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/opendaylight-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Add OpenDaylightConnectionProtocol parameter to opendaylight-api service

OpenDaylightConnectionProtocol is currently only set in opendaylight-ovs
service, it needs to be set in opendaylight-api when Opendaylight is
deployed with another vswitch like VPP.

Closes-Bug: #1665442

Change-Id: Ib20cacd5b15586f96c880ed5a371e7e3c85a7a8c
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add OpenDaylightConnectionProtocol parameter to opendaylight-api service

OpenDaylightConnectionProtocol is currently only set in opendaylight-ovs
service, it needs to be set in opendaylight-api when Opendaylight is
deployed with another vswitch like VPP.

Closes-Bug: #1665442

Change-Id: Ib20cacd5b15586f96c880ed5a371e7e3c85a7a8c
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

It seems that it wasn't intended for us to configure this via the
transport URL, and the recommendation is to do this via the
driver-dependent configurations.

Change-Id: I8b60f61ede53d0814a8c08878abacefaf7fa3d43

commit_message:
Remove ssl configuration via transport_url

It seems that it wasn't intended for us to configure this via the
transport URL, and the recommendation is to do this via the
driver-dependent configurations.

Change-Id: I8b60f61ede53d0814a8c08878abacefaf7fa3d43

in the same fashion that has been working for master.

commit_message:
Compute API Server Actions Test

Adds tests for start, stop of a server API
Partially-Implements: blueprint initial-tests-compute
Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: GUPTA, SANGEET <sg774j@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: BARTRA, RICK <rb560u@att.com>

commit_message:
Use the keystone session loader in the placement reporting

Using load_session_from_conf_options has the advantage that it honors
session settings like cafile and insecure, to make use of non-system TLS
certificates (or disable certificate checks at all). Also client
certificates and timeout values can be specified, too.

Closes-Bug: #1666936
Change-Id: I510a2683958fc8c3aaca9293b4280f325b9551fc
(cherry picked from commit a377fc5988e9a6057bd14617879a7cbcc3c8bb81)

The scheduler needs to list all compute nodes and services in order to
have a list to filter. It does that based on information that it gets
from placement, but it needs to fetch the records out of the database.
This patch makes it do that for all cells, and takes the same approach
that compute api currently does, which is a refreshed-once-per-run

commit_message:
Make scheduler get hosts from all cells

The scheduler needs to list all compute nodes and services in order to
have a list to filter. It does that based on information that it gets
from placement, but it needs to fetch the records out of the database.
This patch makes it do that for all cells, and takes the same approach
that compute api currently does, which is a refreshed-once-per-run
master list of cells that we can optimize later.

For the moment, the scheduler maintains a static list of cells, just
like compute/api does. Ideally before we release pike we will have
a better plan for making this dynamic.

Change-Id: I1a9b054b7ddace1b342ec82a86cb151d45ec8ae2

subject: upgrades: run pingtest at the very end of the CI job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 19:31:04.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': 'upgrades: run pingtest at the very end of the CI job

When upgrade has been completed, run a pingtest to check if we can
actually consume the OpenStack Cloud.

That is a first iteration. The next will be:
1. Run pingtest just before the upgrade
2. Verify that resources survived to the upgrade
3. Run pingtest again when we know resources survived

Change-Id: I83f45efd0b4608ec29489b8f8e717945b22469d4
'}]
commit_message:
upgrades: run pingtest at the very end of the CI job

When upgrade has been completed, run a pingtest to check if we can
actually consume the OpenStack Cloud.

That is a first iteration. The next will be:
1. Run pingtest just before the upgrade
2. Verify that resources survived to the upgrade
3. Run pingtest again when we know resources survived

Change-Id: I83f45efd0b4608ec29489b8f8e717945b22469d4

commit_message:
Use the keystone session loader in the placement reporting

Using load_session_from_conf_options has the advantage that it honors
session settings like cafile and insecure, to make use of non-system TLS
certificates (or disable certificate checks at all). Also client
certificates and timeout values can be specified, too.

Closes-Bug: #1666936
Change-Id: I510a2683958fc8c3aaca9293b4280f325b9551fc

subject: Disable haproxy endpoint drain wait
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-25 23:34:11.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/haproxy-endpoint-manage.yml'], 'message': 'Disable haproxy endpoint drain wait

When haproxy endpoint management has a wait condition for the
connection drain to occur, it causes the module to fail if a backend
is not specified. Since our current implementation relies on backend
auto discovery (since the same host may be present in multiple backends),
this causes the module to fail when it attempts to disable the endpoints.

Change-Id: Ia292e4cb4d8ba73a72af8305cc2006aea9c43e32
'}]
commit_message:
Disable haproxy endpoint drain wait

When haproxy endpoint management has a wait condition for the
connection drain to occur, it causes the module to fail if a backend
is not specified. Since our current implementation relies on backend
auto discovery (since the same host may be present in multiple backends),
this causes the module to fail when it attempts to disable the endpoints.

Change-Id: Ia292e4cb4d8ba73a72af8305cc2006aea9c43e32

subject: Update the Nova Endpoint information for Cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 21:36:35.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/cinder-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Update the Nova Endpoint information for Cinder

This patch updates the Cinder service to reference the correct
catalogue entries for Nova as configured by TripleO. The default
settings as set by TripleO do not match our catalogue entries,
and when Cinder attempts to callback to Nova in certain events
(such as a Cinder volume retype) it can raise an EndpointNotFound
error.

Out of the box we have settings in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf like:

nova_catalog_info = compute:Compute Service:internalURL

With the format as "<service_type>:<service_name>:<endpoint_type>"

Yet our catalogue has no mention of 'Compute Service'. This patch
also fixes the reference for the adminURL also.

Change-Id: I888ee07ef02d82578867e33608901c06e6478472
Co-Authored-By: Greg Charot <gcharot@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update the Nova Endpoint information for Cinder

This patch updates the Cinder service to reference the correct
catalogue entries for Nova as configured by TripleO. The default
settings as set by TripleO do not match our catalogue entries,
and when Cinder attempts to callback to Nova in certain events
(such as a Cinder volume retype) it can raise an EndpointNotFound
error.

Out of the box we have settings in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf like:

nova_catalog_info = compute:Compute Service:internalURL

With the format as "<service_type>:<service_name>:<endpoint_type>"

Yet our catalogue has no mention of 'Compute Service'. This patch
also fixes the reference for the adminURL also.

Change-Id: I888ee07ef02d82578867e33608901c06e6478472
Co-Authored-By: Greg Charot <gcharot@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support both Ubuntu and CentOS

CentOS installs molteniron into /usr/etc/molteniron instead of
/usr/local/etc/molteniron/ so we have moved the conf.yaml file
into the molteniron Python directory and started using
pkg_resources.resource_filename to find our data file.

Change-Id: I75330d51475051a04bb2dff903f54727b9be9b6e

commit_message:
Fix error during 'inventory-manage.py -r' calls

Use load_inventory instead for load_from_json. Rename
load_from_json to _load_from_json.

Move most of the --clear-ip and --remove calls to their
corresponding functions. Modified other calls to account
for the change

Add a test to test for inventory item removal.

fixes bug: 1663328

Change-Id: I2dbecb085383b3d02e298cc09b02566d1e52a064
(cherry picked from commit 3a08bb7b78b52590e9994703262fe54e4e7f7099)

subject: support local.conf files with no [[local]] section yet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-27 15:09:32.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/dsconf.py', 'devstack/tests/test_localconf_set_local.py'], 'message': 'support local.conf files with no [[local]] section yet

Previously if we tried to added content to a local.conf file without a
local section, we actually inserted that content in the wrong place at
the end of the file. This fixes that, with unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib886d78ce5f3718def784db59ba9abf41bdb0e7b
'}]
commit_message:
support local.conf files with no [[local]] section yet

Previously if we tried to added content to a local.conf file without a
local section, we actually inserted that content in the wrong place at
the end of the file. This fixes that, with unit tests.

Change-Id: Ib886d78ce5f3718def784db59ba9abf41bdb0e7b

subject: Fix Jinja2 to <2.9 in upper constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-27 11:55:50.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Fix Jinja2 to <2.9 in upper constraints

This is a followup to I82561d3d738147683499697883d9d03ceb897f3d.

While the Jinja2 bug referenced in that commit was fixed in Jinja==2.9.5,
Ansible community accounted for this bug by hard-coding Jinja<2.9 as
requirement for latest stable Ansible PyPI releases
(2.1.4.0, 2.2.1.0 currently), which makes those Ansible versions incompatible
with current OpenStack upper-constraints
(bumped to 2.9.5 in Ie65cd7c75cce0b4f06fee16cfcb21466b97a93b7).

This patch downgrades upper constraint for Jinja2 back to 2.8.1 again.

Change-Id: I667f2ef7bbcb90bb6e50e57e2bac87a4b02601fe
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Jinja2 to <2.9 in upper constraints

This is a followup to I82561d3d738147683499697883d9d03ceb897f3d.

While the Jinja2 bug referenced in that commit was fixed in Jinja==2.9.5,
Ansible community accounted for this bug by hard-coding Jinja<2.9 as
requirement for latest stable Ansible PyPI releases
(2.1.4.0, 2.2.1.0 currently), which makes those Ansible versions incompatible
with current OpenStack upper-constraints
(bumped to 2.9.5 in Ie65cd7c75cce0b4f06fee16cfcb21466b97a93b7).

This patch downgrades upper constraint for Jinja2 back to 2.8.1 again.

Change-Id: I667f2ef7bbcb90bb6e50e57e2bac87a4b02601fe

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 14:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/volume/test_cinder.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'message': "cinder: accommodate v1 cinder client in detach call

Call Cinder client's detach() with attachment_uuid only if the client
is v2.

Cinder client v2 supports passing volume_id and optionally
attachment_id to its volume manager's detach() method, but v1 does
not, only accepting volume_id. Change I3cdc4992 indiscriminately
passes both volume_id and attachment_id to the Cinder client
regardless of its version, prompting with v1:

   TypeError: detach() takes exactly 2 arguments (3 given)

Change-Id: I2e8b5947521d659e930141b0b8e6a6353e9163bd
(cherry picked from commit a45f5dd7021a15064ae50d07755be9e2bfc22ae9)
Closes-Bug: 1561056
"}]
commit_message:
cinder: accommodate v1 cinder client in detach call

Call Cinder client's detach() with attachment_uuid only if the client
is v2.

Cinder client v2 supports passing volume_id and optionally
attachment_id to its volume manager's detach() method, but v1 does
not, only accepting volume_id. Change I3cdc4992 indiscriminately
passes both volume_id and attachment_id to the Cinder client
regardless of its version, prompting with v1:

   TypeError: detach() takes exactly 2 arguments (3 given)

Change-Id: I2e8b5947521d659e930141b0b8e6a6353e9163bd
(cherry picked from commit a45f5dd7021a15064ae50d07755be9e2bfc22ae9)
Closes-Bug: 1561056

The query parameters can also be used to configure the connection to the
broker, and these were being ignored by this driver. This takes them

Change-Id: Ic36850c9d9df054bf25ba19e5fafd808e4700bad
Closes-Bug: #1666903
'}]
commit_message:
RabbitMQ: Take into account query parameters in transport url

The query parameters can also be used to configure the connection to the
broker, and these were being ignored by this driver. This takes them
into use.

Change-Id: Ic36850c9d9df054bf25ba19e5fafd808e4700bad
Closes-Bug: #1666903

commit_message:
Add active/active info to generate_driver_list

This patch adds active/active support information to the
`generate_driver_list.py` script so we can know which drivers support
Active/Active configurations.

Change-Id: Ic596fa83665b045a839d6874330b41406e1de522

commit_message:
Add replication info to generate_driver_list

This patch adds replication information to the `generate_driver_list.py`
script so we can know which drivers support replication v2.1 and which
ones support replication v2.1 in Active/Active fashion.

Possible values reported for replication are:
 - No
 - Yes (only in Active/Passive configurations)
 - Yes

Change-Id: I8edd43e88d9b2d145855b5bad9f4995dda46449b

commit_message:
Add link to the python documentation about the NullHandler

To avoid confusion about why we add a NullHandler to logging this patch
is adding a link to the python documentation with the explanation why we
should do that for libraries.

commit_message:
Add cinder multi-backend tests

This commit updates templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2 and the
default tempest_test_whitelist to expose a cinder multi-backend test.
This is useful for ensuring that a) multiple backends are operational
(ceph/LVM for instance), while also testing that the multi-backend
features are functional.

NOTE: We also change the tests to use the sahara tempest plugin rather
      than designate as the designate plugin appears to be broken at
      the moment.

Change-Id: I4a730614cfb695b82a79dfbe540396e5f4fd198a
(cherry picked from commit d4c8ecf824b9e4a7f8dde85aee2301cdbfa9867b)

subject: Add cinder multi-backend tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 21:02:08.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add cinder multi-backend tests

(cherry picked from commit d4c8ecf824b9e4a7f8dde85aee2301cdbfa9867b)

commit_message:
Add cinder multi-backend tests

This commit updates templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2 and the
default tempest_test_whitelist to expose a cinder multi-backend test.
This is useful for ensuring that a) multiple backends are operational
(ceph/LVM for instance), while also testing that the multi-backend
features are functional.

NOTE: In master and stable/ocata we updated the tests to use the sahara
      tempest plugin rather than the designate one as master of that
      plugin does not run at the moment.  However, as stable/newton is
      pinned to a specific SHA for the designate plugin, we leave it as
      is rather than changing to the sahara plugin. This is the reason
      for the conflict below.

Conflicts:
	tests/os_tempest-overrides.yml

Change-Id: I4a730614cfb695b82a79dfbe540396e5f4fd198a
(cherry picked from commit d4c8ecf824b9e4a7f8dde85aee2301cdbfa9867b)

commit_message:

This is a follow-on to I8bc3f0e84b2812bbf7f8a9f54c870115ebbb052d.
34.3.0 [1] was released a few hours ago (as of this writing) and still
exhibits the same problem.  Bump excludes up to this new release.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/releases/tag/v34.3.0

Change-Id: I9c57c08a150571c5bb62235d502839394d53a4c1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-27 09:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['manila/pre_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "manila: use local.conf in pre_test_hook script

As per,
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112872.html
a devstack plugin's pre_test_hook script can set options
in local.conf and not in localrc. Do so to unblock gate,
gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-cephfs-native

Closes-bug: #1668197

Change-Id: Ic426935f0c5c5aa66fddf496b6b97350ec56b5e5
"}]
commit_message:
manila: use local.conf in pre_test_hook script

As per,
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112872.html
a devstack plugin's pre_test_hook script can set options
in local.conf and not in localrc. Do so to unblock gate,
gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-cephfs-native

Closes-bug: #1668197

Change-Id: Ic426935f0c5c5aa66fddf496b6b97350ec56b5e5

This will separate out the runs so that varaibles and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on

Change-Id: Iacaf5919a468cf267418718fdac5c270674a3454
(cherry picked from commit f5adedd2e4ae4693d0b323fed749c718cafd0fb1)
"}]
commit_message:
Split out Keystone upgrade into it's own script

This will separate out the runs so that varaibles and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on
non-upgrade runs.

Change-Id: Iacaf5919a468cf267418718fdac5c270674a3454
(cherry picked from commit f5adedd2e4ae4693d0b323fed749c718cafd0fb1)

commit_message:
Fix the deletePlan action

In case of failure of plan deletion, a non-existant function
(planDeleted) was called. This was due to a previous refactor
which renamed the function but didn't fix the invocations.
This patch fixes the issue so that the correct function
(deletePlanFailed) is now called.

Closes-bug: #1667691
Change-Id: I12fcfd6f94b90378055cabc3a65ecb3f012f6f91
(cherry picked from commit 02609106c1e51674adcabe1fa4ac48b6467be0be)

commit_message:
Use domain_context not effective domain to display domains list

Use domain_context to decide whether to call domain_list or domain_get
in the list of domains. Previous code used the user's effective domain
instead, which is no longer the same thing with Keystone V3.

Closes-Bug: #1660602

Change-Id: Ie410d282c5b19a061fe83b496785f35bbcfad9ad
(cherry picked from commit 1be065aed8e330c746f85f9600d2c60c4478a661)

commit_message:
Add Port-Create in Project Dashboard

Gives end-users the ability to create and delete ports in their
networks. The functionality will be implemented into the project
network details table.

Following the discussions in the bug discussion.
This functionality will be enabled/disabled via policy.

Change-Id: I560b42b94acb6a2424fbc9b574b6e376c34ac9ee
Implements Blueprint: network-ports-tenant
Closes-Bug: #1399252
Co-Authored-By: kenji-i<ken-ishii@sx.jp.nec.com>

commit_message:
Add rule "update_network:shared" to neutron_policy.json

This rule is referenced by networks panel and is required for
enabling non-admin users to change the name of networks.

This change has been committed to master in commit
d599fdec599db99f3c8b73ffce18a140bae8e629

That commit is too big for back-porting to stable/mitaka as-is,
thus I am proposing this one-line commit to fix the issue at
hand for stable/mitaka.

Change-Id: I93ef6e09f37557dc2375d7672d2a247c776ec2bb
Closes-Bug: #1609467

subject: Unblock security role gate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-27 13:24:02.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/auditd.yml', 'templates/osas-auditd.j2', 'tests/test.yml'], 'message': "Unblock security role gate

This patch addresses two issues that are blocking the security role
CI jobs from completing:

The OpenStack CI image is missing the default audit.rules file and this
causes augenrules to fail when it loads new rules. The first line in
the default rules file deletes existing rules and this must be in
place before loading new rulesets. The contents of the default file
are now in the template file, which is safer anyway. The default
file provided by the OS is removed.

The task that updates the apt cache in test.yml was running more than
once during the CI job run when the gate ran slowly. That's fine, but
it breaks the idempotence checks. A `changed_when` is added to the task
to ensure that the idempotence tests aren't affected by an apt cache
update.

Change-Id: I48be02df02b8a2a401bfd96e16ea0329632d9381
Partial-Bug: #1662622
"}]
commit_message:
Unblock security role gate

This patch addresses two issues that are blocking the security role
CI jobs from completing:

The OpenStack CI image is missing the default audit.rules file and this
causes augenrules to fail when it loads new rules. The first line in
the default rules file deletes existing rules and this must be in
place before loading new rulesets. The contents of the default file
are now in the template file, which is safer anyway. The default
file provided by the OS is removed.

The task that updates the apt cache in test.yml was running more than
once during the CI job run when the gate ran slowly. That's fine, but
it breaks the idempotence checks. A `changed_when` is added to the task
to ensure that the idempotence tests aren't affected by an apt cache
update.

Change-Id: I48be02df02b8a2a401bfd96e16ea0329632d9381
Partial-Bug: #1662622

commit_message:
Use specific end version since liberty is EOL

Liberty will never be released again, so I'm changing the 1.0.x to 1.0.5
(the last liberty release of ironic python agent), as a followup to
a2a0db727d8c54145645710cb1d0bf6a3b1ab26c.

Change-Id: I07b348d62706150b8ec6f6e4220ec905ab0ec9c8

commit_message:
Use RDO package for Newton

We are currently using centos- package, which can
be somewhat conflictual, because it brings openstack
repos, but also ceph. This commit ensures we
are using the same kind of packages everywhere (RDO).

Change-Id: Id68a300c8060561a82dbba5f9499c9da984dd969

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-27 14:07:56.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/pre_install.yml'], 'message': 'Allow the manipulation of multiple keys/repos

When doing an upgrade, or if your repo is built differently (like
per version), you probably want a facility to remove an older repo
to move to a new repo.

In order to do that, we can use a list instead of using the repo
data immediately. Some of our roles already have this behavior,
and now we make it consistent.

Change-Id: I5690ecb94c1f8a70a506d65339d7108081c138b7
(cherry picked from commit 6dd2d44b0220856389f6d2be4d42880c9145f51e)

commit_message:
Allow the manipulation of multiple keys/repos

When doing an upgrade, or if your repo is built differently (like
per version), you probably want a facility to remove an older repo
to move to a new repo.

In order to do that, we can use a list instead of using the repo
data immediately. Some of our roles already have this behavior,
and now we make it consistent.

Change-Id: I5690ecb94c1f8a70a506d65339d7108081c138b7
(cherry picked from commit 6dd2d44b0220856389f6d2be4d42880c9145f51e)

commit_message:
Allow the manipulation of multiple keys/repos

When doing an upgrade, or if your repo is built differently (like
per version), you probably want a facility to remove an older repo
to move to a new repo.

In order to do that, we can use a list instead of using the repo
data immediately. Some of our roles already have this behavior,
and now we make it consistent.

Change-Id: I5690ecb94c1f8a70a506d65339d7108081c138b7
(cherry picked from commit 6dd2d44b0220856389f6d2be4d42880c9145f51e)

subject: Allow the manipulation of multiple keys/repos
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-27 12:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/pre_install.yml'], 'message': 'Allow the manipulation of multiple keys/repos

When doing an upgrade, or if your repo is built differently (like
per version), you probably want a facility to remove an older repo
to move to a new repo.

In order to do that, we can use a list instead of using the repo
data immediately. Some of our roles already have this behavior,
and now we make it consistent.

Change-Id: I5690ecb94c1f8a70a506d65339d7108081c138b7
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the manipulation of multiple keys/repos

When doing an upgrade, or if your repo is built differently (like
per version), you probably want a facility to remove an older repo
to move to a new repo.

In order to do that, we can use a list instead of using the repo
data immediately. Some of our roles already have this behavior,
and now we make it consistent.

Change-Id: I5690ecb94c1f8a70a506d65339d7108081c138b7

commit_message:
Make it possible to customize the list of extradisks to be created

The new parameter extradisks_list is meant to allow for customization
of the number of extradisks to be created. It defaults to creating
three disks as it was previously.

subject: Wait for each putter to be done before disconnection's error handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 13:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': 'Wait for each putter to be done before disconnection's error handling

on a PUT action on the EC storage policy, some socket leaks between the proxy and object-server will appears (final CLOSE_WAIT state on the proxy side).
close() is called on each socket but following the doc "Sockets are automatically closed when they are garbage-collected", there is still a reference to the socket.
calling wait() on each putter to ensure there is no more pending task before handling the disconnect error, will correctly clear the socket.

Change-Id: Ice9977bf8623a9afa4c2841f53847ade2fde45a4
Closes-Bug: #1662159
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for each putter to be done before disconnection's error handling

on a PUT action on the EC storage policy, some socket leaks between the proxy and object-server will appears (final CLOSE_WAIT state on the proxy side).
close() is called on each socket but following the doc "Sockets are automatically closed when they are garbage-collected", there is still a reference to the socket.
calling wait() on each putter to ensure there is no more pending task before handling the disconnect error, will correctly clear the socket.

Change-Id: Ice9977bf8623a9afa4c2841f53847ade2fde45a4
Closes-Bug: #1662159

commit_message:
Ansible role for built packages install

Take the repository comressed file, which was built by
build-test-packages role and install packages from it on live
host or inject them into the image with modify-image role.

Change-Id: I0305cfb917500a5890d74cadf9299d6538262282

commit_message:
Don't assume default network names in net_ip*map

This needs to handle a ServiceNetMap containing non-default
network names when they are overridden via the *NetName parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1651541
Change-Id: I95d808444642a37612a495e822e50449a7e7da63
(cherry picked from commit 47f2579fa24e722b451c29b5f6435c5b5fe65429)

commit_message:
Make Murano an experimental feature

Since Fuel 10, Murano service becomes an experimental feature.

* Murano settings are shown on Settings tab in Fuel UI
  only if "experimental" feature group is enabled
* Murano option is removed from the cluster creation wizard

Implements: blueprint make-murano-experimental

Change-Id: I4dd0853138c045b8d7e8f6ff940c09250763a56b

subject: Don't recalculate EndpointMap to get outputs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-03 22:52:30.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud.j2.yaml'], 'message': "Don't recalculate EndpointMap to get outputs

As of Ocata, whenever Heat needs to get the value of an output from a
nested Stack it will still load the Stack in memory and re-resolve the
output value. This means that the EndpointMap's endpoint_map output, which
is huge, gets loaded and recalculated whenever showing the EndpointMap or
KeystoneUrl outputs of the main (overcloud) stack. To avoid this, store the
value locally in an OS::Heat::Value resource. This means that the
EndpointMap will only be resolved once, during the stack create/update, and
the outputs can refer to that value.

Change-Id: Ia79eceeea309f5508713a310849f5d366a035430
Depends-On: If0f80cab94c28514d1569b1025362ab9d9d31512
"}]
commit_message:
Don't recalculate EndpointMap to get outputs

As of Ocata, whenever Heat needs to get the value of an output from a
nested Stack it will still load the Stack in memory and re-resolve the
output value. This means that the EndpointMap's endpoint_map output, which
is huge, gets loaded and recalculated whenever showing the EndpointMap or
KeystoneUrl outputs of the main (overcloud) stack. To avoid this, store the
value locally in an OS::Heat::Value resource. This means that the
EndpointMap will only be resolved once, during the stack create/update, and
the outputs can refer to that value.

Change-Id: Ia79eceeea309f5508713a310849f5d366a035430
Depends-On: If0f80cab94c28514d1569b1025362ab9d9d31512

commit_message:
Install openstack-heat-agents on upgrade

This package wasn't installed in the Newton image and we need to
install it during upgrade to be able to skip preupgrade validations.

Change-Id: If6ee7a3801756ac445ae35534803eab175ad8e40
Closes-Bug: 1667967

commit_message:
Stop handling interface drivers that don't support MTU

We were issuing a deprecation warning for interface drivers that have
not accepted mtu= argument for a cycle. It's time to clean that code
path up.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I47eca98c25d4f5a30a5a726d5edc1a919954a280

not be enabled without explicit administrator intervention.

subject: Add full path for Property
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-20 09:19:54.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_properties.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py'], 'message': 'Add full path for Property

Add full path field for Property class. Now
properties with sub-schemas should contain properties
with path, where their parent specified. For example,
if there is schema:
        "a": type map:
               schema:
                 "b": type string,
                 "c": type string

Then property "a" has path == 'a', "b" has path == 'a.b',
"c" has path == 'a.c'.

Change-Id: I6d0ba022f34b925d47142669d6076ebd63a2acdc
Related-bug: #1620859
'}]
commit_message:
Add full path for Property

Add full path field for Property class. Now
properties with sub-schemas should contain properties
with path, where their parent specified. For example,
if there is schema:
        "a": type map:
               schema:
                 "b": type string,
                 "c": type string

Then property "a" has path == 'a', "b" has path == 'a.b',
"c" has path == 'a.c'.

Change-Id: I6d0ba022f34b925d47142669d6076ebd63a2acdc
Related-bug: #1620859

commit_message:
Switch to use idempotent_id decorator from tempest.lib

Decorator idempotent_id() in tempest.test is deprecated and
tempest.lib.decorators.idempotent_id() should be used instead.
This patch switch all tempest tests to use new decorator.

Change-Id: I2df9c13fbb44b8807da6805761ad30bfd010dc55

bifrost-3.0.0 is affected by a setuptools bug preventing it from being

to the Bifrost master branch in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437010/.

commit_message:
Workaround for setuptools bug affecting Bifrost

bifrost-3.0.0 is affected by a setuptools bug preventing it from being
installed. This change patches Bifrost with the workaround committed
to the Bifrost master branch in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437010/.
If/when that change gets backported to Bifrost stable/ocata and then
released as 3.0.1, we can remove this workaround.

Change-Id: I257abd86599304ef1992d10da20130c9b7c25e46
Closes-Bug: #1667308

Change-Id: I90ff1055d367609694eef975c7d084e4cd7a2cf4
Closes-Bug: 1628455
Needed-By: Idd2315565cc9c88319984d83487148bf498e91ab

commit_message:
OpenFlowSwitchMixin: do not override delete_flows

With this change the delete_flow variant implementation
of OpenFlowSwitchMixin, which was overriding the parent implementation
from ovs_lib in an incompatible way using the native ryu implementation,
is renamed into uninstall_flows.

As discussed in bug 1628455, the approach consisting in
extending the _keyword dict to convert ovs-ofctl rules into ryu
parameters does not seem practical.

This change also updates calls to delete_flows so that, when
enabled, the native interface will be used.  Similar calls outside neutron
repo need to be updated as well, which will be done in separate changes.

Change-Id: I90ff1055d367609694eef975c7d084e4cd7a2cf4
Closes-Bug: 1628455
Needed-By: Idd2315565cc9c88319984d83487148bf498e91ab

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-02-27 06:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': 'Do not change mcollective config

The idea is to stop changing mcollective config and restarting it from
nailgun agent. This causes a lot of problems related to mcollective
config restarted at wrong time. From now at the bootstrap stage
mcollective is expected to be configured and started by startup scripts
while in bootstrap and by cloud-init at first boot into provisioned
node.

Change-Id: Ic8e31d6381d8ffb8f7fdfd1aa8ebc655bb4535ec
Partial-Bug: #1585671
Depends-On: Ia2f984570b38642b1090f6483ed3fa78958550c5'}]
commit_message:
Do not change mcollective config

The idea is to stop changing mcollective config and restarting it from
nailgun agent. This causes a lot of problems related to mcollective
config restarted at wrong time. From now at the bootstrap stage
mcollective is expected to be configured and started by startup scripts
while in bootstrap and by cloud-init at first boot into provisioned
node.

Change-Id: Ic8e31d6381d8ffb8f7fdfd1aa8ebc655bb4535ec
Partial-Bug: #1585671
Depends-On: Ia2f984570b38642b1090f6483ed3fa78958550c5

subject: support gnocchi timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-02-24 21:31:07.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/gnocchi_client.py', 'ceilometer/keystone_client.py', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi_opts.py'], 'message': "support gnocchi timeout

set gnocchi timeout to 6.05 because requests recommends multiple
of 3[1]. also, it seems safe to assume gnocchi is not functioning well
and will not scale if we can't post in 6s. in my benchmark, it took
under 0.25s to post 5000 points. the only thing that took >3s was
getting >80K datapoints and this workflow is only pushing, and only
getting small chunks occasionally. making it 6s because it seems
keystone adds decent overhead.

do not set timeout for upgrade because it might take longer than normal
workflow

[1] http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/advanced/#timeouts

Change-Id: I41b5e4f0c0f54b7f4b627d9116e63096ca2decf9
Closes-Bug: #1666072
"}]
commit_message:
support gnocchi timeout

set gnocchi timeout to 6.05 because requests recommends multiple
of 3[1]. also, it seems safe to assume gnocchi is not functioning well
and will not scale if we can't post in 6s. in my benchmark, it took
under 0.25s to post 5000 points. the only thing that took >3s was
getting >80K datapoints and this workflow is only pushing, and only
getting small chunks occasionally. making it 6s because it seems
keystone adds decent overhead.

do not set timeout for upgrade because it might take longer than normal
workflow

[1] http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/advanced/#timeouts

Change-Id: I41b5e4f0c0f54b7f4b627d9116e63096ca2decf9
Closes-Bug: #1666072

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-21 12:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['devops/shell.py', 'devops/tests/test_shell.py', 'devops/models/node.py'], 'message': "Extend 'slave-ip-list' CLI options

- show address pool names or specify an --address-pool-name=<...>
- show node names or set --ip-only flag

Output examples:

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test
public-pool01: master,10.100.0.128 slave-0,10.100.0.129 slave-1,10.100.0.130
neutron-pool01: master,10.100.2.2 slave-0,10.100.2.3 slave-1,10.100.2.4
private-pool01: master,10.100.1.128 slave-0,10.100.1.129 slave-1,10.100.1.130

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test  --ip-only
public-pool01: 10.100.0.128 10.100.0.129 10.100.0.130
neutron-pool01: 10.100.2.2 10.100.2.3 10.100.2.4
private-pool01: 10.100.1.128 10.100.1.129 10.100.1.130

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test --address-pool-name=public-pool01
master,10.100.0.128 slave-0,10.100.0.129 slave-1,10.100.0.130

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test --address-pool-name=public-pool01 --ip-only
10.100.0.128 10.100.0.129 10.100.0.130

Change-Id: I75635f73b90f37d9e50de1772bc7da6720c41cec
Related-Bug:#1658630
"}]
commit_message:
Extend 'slave-ip-list' CLI options

- show address pool names or specify an --address-pool-name=<...>
- show node names or set --ip-only flag

Output examples:

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test
public-pool01: master,10.100.0.128 slave-0,10.100.0.129 slave-1,10.100.0.130
neutron-pool01: master,10.100.2.2 slave-0,10.100.2.3 slave-1,10.100.2.4
private-pool01: master,10.100.1.128 slave-0,10.100.1.129 slave-1,10.100.1.130

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test  --ip-only
public-pool01: 10.100.0.128 10.100.0.129 10.100.0.130
neutron-pool01: 10.100.2.2 10.100.2.3 10.100.2.4
private-pool01: 10.100.1.128 10.100.1.129 10.100.1.130

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test --address-pool-name=public-pool01
master,10.100.0.128 slave-0,10.100.0.129 slave-1,10.100.0.130

$ dos.py slave-ip-list ac_linear_test --address-pool-name=public-pool01 --ip-only
10.100.0.128 10.100.0.129 10.100.0.130

Change-Id: I75635f73b90f37d9e50de1772bc7da6720c41cec

commit_message:
Change default db reconnection tries count to -1

This change is needed for cases with big time interval
between Ceilometer services which need a db and
database backend starting.
Otherwise, Ceilometer API defines storage connection to None
and all storage requests fail permanently.

Change-Id: Ic442ff42e225f98a7a06469b2ff77d95fac84e2b
Closes-bug: #1611023

subject: Add limit, offset, order in collection GET
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8766, 'name': 'Julia Aranovich', 'email': 'jkirnosova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'CesarSar'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 01:09:31.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/base.py'], 'message': 'Add limit, offset, order in collection GET

Allow limiting the number of objects returned via GET
by providing "limit"
Example: api/notifications?limit=5

Allow offseting (skipping N first records) via "offset"
Example: api/notifications?offset=100

Allow ordering of objects by providing "order_by"
Example: api/notifications?order_by=-id

Add helper functions/classes to:
- get HTTP parameters (limit, offset, order_by)
- get scoped collection query by applying 4 operations
  filter, order, offset, limit
- set Conent-Range header if scope limits are present

Make default NailgunCollection's GET utilize scoped query
This makes default (parent) GET of child handlers support paging
and ordering (overriden GET methods will not get this functionality
automatically)
NailgunCollection.GET is also an example of how to implement
this new functionality.

Helper functions/classes can be utilized in child handler methods
to implement filters / ordering / paging

Related-Bug: 1657348
Change-Id: I7760465f70b3f69791e7a0c558a26e8ba55c934a
(cherry picked from commit 03aaca2deeb062e962a81d16c2a75fb5fccfc265)
'}]
commit_message:
Add limit, offset, order in collection GET

Allow limiting the number of objects returned via GET
by providing "limit"
Example: api/notifications?limit=5

Allow offseting (skipping N first records) via "offset"
Example: api/notifications?offset=100

Allow ordering of objects by providing "order_by"
Example: api/notifications?order_by=-id

Add helper functions/classes to:
- get HTTP parameters (limit, offset, order_by)
- get scoped collection query by applying 4 operations
  filter, order, offset, limit
- set Conent-Range header if scope limits are present

Make default NailgunCollection's GET utilize scoped query
This makes default (parent) GET of child handlers support paging
and ordering (overriden GET methods will not get this functionality
automatically)
NailgunCollection.GET is also an example of how to implement
this new functionality.

Helper functions/classes can be utilized in child handler methods
to implement filters / ordering / paging

Related-Bug: 1657348
Change-Id: I7760465f70b3f69791e7a0c558a26e8ba55c934a
(cherry picked from commit 03aaca2deeb062e962a81d16c2a75fb5fccfc265)

commit_message:
Make Murano an experimental feature

Since Fuel 10, Murano service becomes an experimental feature.

* Murano settings are shown on Settings tab in Fuel UI
  only if "experimental" feature group is enabled
* Murano option is removed from the cluster creation wizard

Implements: blueprint make-murano-experimental

Change-Id: I4dd0853138c045b8d7e8f6ff940c09250763a56b

delete-security-group can delete from default vpc by group-name

authorize_security_group_ingress with group-name specified
create rule in the appropriate group in default vpc

Change-Id: Ibdf5b508f9d8a042ceaba4570d4573b741adaf9f
'}]
commit_message:
Changes in security groups in default VPC mode

create-security-group create security-group in default vpc
if not specified

delete-security-group can delete from default vpc by group-name

authorize_security_group_ingress with group-name specified
create rule in the appropriate group in default vpc

Change-Id: Ibdf5b508f9d8a042ceaba4570d4573b741adaf9f

subject: roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Reboot if DHCP configuration fails
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 13:01:00.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/inspector-default-boot-ipxe.j2'], 'message': "roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Reboot if DHCP configuration fails

If the 'dhcp' command failed, then simply reboot the target. This aims
to fix some iPXE boot failures like the following one:

net0: 52:54:00:4a:4e:de using rtl8139 on PCI00:03.0 (open)
  [Link:up, TX:0 TXE:0 RX:0 RXE:0]
  Configuring (net0 52:54:00:4a:4e:de)................ Error 0x040ee119
  (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
  No more network devices
  No bootable device.

The existing 'chain ... || reboot' command we already have in boot.ipxe
is not enough since that will only capture 'chain' command failures.
However, in this case, the 'chain' command succeeds (we succesfully
transfer control to the chained script) but it's the chained script
that fails so we need to handle errors in that script separately.

Change-Id: I2b27ba75eddf1b77e2a3a45453cf06eed29cc89f
"}]
commit_message:
roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Reboot if DHCP configuration fails

If the 'dhcp' command failed, then simply reboot the target. This aims
to fix some iPXE boot failures like the following one:

net0: 52:54:00:4a:4e:de using rtl8139 on PCI00:03.0 (open)
  [Link:up, TX:0 TXE:0 RX:0 RXE:0]
  Configuring (net0 52:54:00:4a:4e:de)................ Error 0x040ee119
  (http://ipxe.org/040ee119)
  No more network devices
  No bootable device.

The existing 'chain ... || reboot' command we already have in boot.ipxe
is not enough since that will only capture 'chain' command failures.
However, in this case, the 'chain' command succeeds (we succesfully
transfer control to the chained script) but it's the chained script
that fails so we need to handle errors in that script separately.

Change-Id: I2b27ba75eddf1b77e2a3a45453cf06eed29cc89f

In order to maintain consistency with create_vm, update_vm
should also set the *DataRoot paths to the same given value.

Furthermore, this will be required for planned VMs, in order to
prevent having instances running on different compute nodes and
different storages to have some of the *DataRoot paths pointing to
the old compute node.

Partial-Bug: #1663238

Change-Id: Ic9248f44de6ff097b8080a80fd3212eeef6712f6
'}]
commit_message:
vmutils: set all *DataRoot paths to the same value

In order to maintain consistency with create_vm, update_vm
should also set the *DataRoot paths to the same given value.

Furthermore, this will be required for planned VMs, in order to
prevent having instances running on different compute nodes and
different storages to have some of the *DataRoot paths pointing to
the old compute node.

Partial-Bug: #1663238

Change-Id: Ic9248f44de6ff097b8080a80fd3212eeef6712f6

Currently Properties has arg "parent_name", which
is used for detailed path in error and allows to

commit_message:
Fix using parent_name for Properties

Currently Properties has arg "parent_name", which
is used for detailed path in error and allows to
build path for nested properties schemas. But on
top parent_name takes resource name as initial,
which is few incorrect - Properties should raises
with error about Properties, other info (about in
what resource this error raised) should be built out of
Properties module.

Change-Id: I36e6453a1589c02a3f8cf2c080b38693b23b0f1b
Related-bug: #1620859

subject: Add barbican-tempest-plugin tests to Castellan
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 22:11:07.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add barbican-tempest-plugin tests to Castellan

Castellan is used by various projects (nova, glance, cinder, etc.)
for different security features (including image signing, cinder
volume encryption, and ephemeral storage encryption).  As scenario
tests are being added to the barbican-tempest-plugin for these
features, it would be valuable to confirm that changes to castellan
to not break these features.

This change adds an experimental gate check to castellan for
the barbican-tempest-plugin, including setting the variable
LIBS_FROM_GIT=castellan to cause the current patchset of castellan
to be used instead of the latest version from pypi.

Change-Id: Ic5b3e86e8f58916bd645a8a7f0d701e8757830ed
'}]
commit_message:
Add barbican-tempest-plugin tests to Castellan

Castellan is used by various projects (nova, glance, cinder, etc.)
for different security features (including image signing, cinder
volume encryption, and ephemeral storage encryption).  As scenario
tests are being added to the barbican-tempest-plugin for these
features, it would be valuable to confirm that changes to castellan
to not break these features.

This change adds an experimental gate check to castellan for
the barbican-tempest-plugin, including setting the variable
LIBS_FROM_GIT=castellan to cause the current patchset of castellan
to be used instead of the latest version from pypi.

Change-Id: Ic5b3e86e8f58916bd645a8a7f0d701e8757830ed

commit_message:
Add os-traits project

The intent is for the os-traits repo to be managed by the nova team so
I've referenced the nova ACL config.  However, the os-traits library
does not yet have stable branches so some of that config is unused.  I
don't know if this is a problem.

Needed-By: Iebfe4fd37111a1a044cc9369197e638f3efca52b
Change-Id: Ic807f128180f1af4ecac193db8f99c47913eb5b4

subject: Fix cancel update for nova server with defined port
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-09 07:41:48.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server_network_mixin.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server.py', 'heat_integrationtests/common/test.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_cancel_update.py'], 'message': "Fix cancel update for nova server with defined port

This particular patch fixes a behaviour of cancel update for
nova server with defined port, so there are no ports manageable
by nova. We have these issues while restoring ports after rollback:
1) We doesn't detach any ports from current server, because we
doesn't save them to resoruce data. (we store this data after
succesfull create of the server)
2) Detaching an interface from current server will fail, if the server
will be in building state, so we need to wait until server will be
in active or in error state.
Refresh ports list to solve problem (1).
Wait until nova moves to active/error state to solve (2).
A functional test to prove the fix was added. Note, that this test is
skipped for convergence engine tests until cancel update will work
properly in convergence mode (see bug 1533176).

Partial-Bug: #1570908
Change-Id: If6fd916068a425eea6dc795192f286cb5ffcb794
(cherry picked from commit 584efe3329143e28fdb42b5d9496977f5cdf275a)
(cherry picked from commit 9ece778613d67feff35342aeaa6618aaa5f6fc85)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cancel update for nova server with defined port

This particular patch fixes a behaviour of cancel update for
nova server with defined port, so there are no ports manageable
by nova. We have these issues while restoring ports after rollback:
1) We doesn't detach any ports from current server, because we
doesn't save them to resoruce data. (we store this data after
succesfull create of the server)
2) Detaching an interface from current server will fail, if the server
will be in building state, so we need to wait until server will be
in active or in error state.
Refresh ports list to solve problem (1).
Wait until nova moves to active/error state to solve (2).
A functional test to prove the fix was added. Note, that this test is
skipped for convergence engine tests until cancel update will work
properly in convergence mode (see bug 1533176).

Partial-Bug: #1570908
Change-Id: If6fd916068a425eea6dc795192f286cb5ffcb794
(cherry picked from commit 584efe3329143e28fdb42b5d9496977f5cdf275a)
(cherry picked from commit 9ece778613d67feff35342aeaa6618aaa5f6fc85)

commit_message:
simple_cell_setup should not return 1 when there is no compute hosts

When deploying ironic environment, even though nova-compute is running,
but there will be no compute nodes until adding ironic nodes. And the
user may not start nova-compute for some reason during fresh deployment.

So stop return 1 when there is no compute hosts in simple_cell_setup.

Closes-Bug: #1665674
Change-Id: If3d100a48740d1b5884c4dbaaa8f1c6265a295f2

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Ibd293f102bc0201d5d451549d37458bef352d930
(cherry picked from commit c18d9704affafd19876e65d326ec27fc129604c3)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 13404, 'name': 'Alberto Planas', 'email': 'aplanas@gmail.com', 'username': 'aplanas'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-23 18:40:47.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add bcrypt and scrypt to global-requirements

Keystone needs to support better password hashing. The recommended hash
mechanisms is either bcrypt or scrypt. Generally speaking, the sha2 based
hashing is widely considered completely insufficient for off-line
bruteforcing. Currently keystone uses sha512_crypt instead of bcrypt
or scrypt. Keystone will be adding support for both bcrypt and scrypt
and ceasing use of sha512_crypt (except for passwords that were already
hashed with sha512_crypt). Use of passlib.hash.bcrypt requires the
bcrypt libarary, likewise use of passlib.hash.scrypt requires the
scrypt library.

Both bcrypt and scrypt are actively maintained.

These are the standard libraries used by passlib for the given functions.

Both libraries are released and compatible with python 3.

Bcrypt is Apache2 License. Scrypt is BSD-2-clause license.

Bcrypt is packaged for Ubuntu and Fedora. Scrypt is packaged for
Ubuntu but not packaged for Fedora.

Passlib recommends bcrypt instead of the alternative options
especially for python3.

Passlib recommends the scrypt libary as the the built-in backend is
~100x slower than the packaged version.

These will be required for passwords handled in keystone.

Change-Id: Ia549b0b4d7d6c24f9ba3da6daa04e28e441267f5
'}]
commit_message:
Add bcrypt and scrypt to global-requirements

Keystone needs to support better password hashing. The recommended hash
mechanisms is either bcrypt or scrypt. Generally speaking, the sha2 based
hashing is widely considered completely insufficient for off-line
bruteforcing. Currently keystone uses sha512_crypt instead of bcrypt
or scrypt. Keystone will be adding support for both bcrypt and scrypt
and ceasing use of sha512_crypt (except for passwords that were already
hashed with sha512_crypt). Use of passlib.hash.bcrypt requires the
bcrypt libarary, likewise use of passlib.hash.scrypt requires the
scrypt library.

Both bcrypt and scrypt are actively maintained.

These are the standard libraries used by passlib for the given functions.

Both libraries are released and compatible with python 3.

Bcrypt is Apache2 License. Scrypt is BSD-2-clause license.

Bcrypt is packaged for Ubuntu and Fedora. Scrypt is packaged for
Ubuntu but not packaged for Fedora.

Passlib recommends bcrypt instead of the alternative options
especially for python3.

Passlib recommends the scrypt libary as the the built-in backend is
~100x slower than the packaged version.

These will be required for passwords handled in keystone.

Change-Id: Ia549b0b4d7d6c24f9ba3da6daa04e28e441267f5

subject: Fix CVE-2016-7404
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-26 14:46:15.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/write-heat-params-master.yaml', 'magnum/templates/swarm/fragments/write-heat-params.yaml', 'magnum/templates/mesos/fragments/write-heat-params.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix CVE-2016-7404

This commit is a bare-bones stable/mitaka backport of the fix for
CVE-2016-7404. It only retains

* Permissions for /etc/sysconfig/heat-params inside Magnum
  created instances are tightened to 0600 (used to be 0755).

from the original patch. This was done for two reasons:

* Since stable/mitaka only passes tokens (which expire eventually)
  an attacker would have to gain access to the instance within
  a very short time window (the token expiration time).

* Backporting the remaining changes would have required
  backporting the trusts infrastructure that was only
  completed in stable/newton. This would mean a considerable
  change in the stable/mitaka default behaviour.

Please note, that this change does not apply apply to existing
clusters. They will have to be deleted and rebuilt to benefit
from these changes.

(cherry picked from commit 0bb0d6486d6771ee21bbf897a091b1aa59e01b22)

Change-Id: I329d29cdcce2225f8aa5b57852e6a37d4f8aaa3e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix CVE-2016-7404

This commit is a bare-bones stable/mitaka backport of the fix for
CVE-2016-7404. It only retains

* Permissions for /etc/sysconfig/heat-params inside Magnum
  created instances are tightened to 0600 (used to be 0755).

from the original patch. This was done for two reasons:

* Since stable/mitaka only passes tokens (which expire eventually)
  an attacker would have to gain access to the instance within
  a very short time window (the token expiration time).

* Backporting the remaining changes would have required
  backporting the trusts infrastructure that was only
  completed in stable/newton. This would mean a considerable
  change in the stable/mitaka default behaviour.

Please note, that this change does not apply apply to existing
clusters. They will have to be deleted and rebuilt to benefit
from these changes.

(cherry picked from commit 0bb0d6486d6771ee21bbf897a091b1aa59e01b22)

Change-Id: I329d29cdcce2225f8aa5b57852e6a37d4f8aaa3e

commit_message:
[09/xx] Introduce models package and move old models inside

This patch adds dragonflow.db.models package and moves the previous
models module inside, it also places all the previously available models
in package's __init__ so no external code needs to be modified for now

Partially-Implements: blueprint refactor-nb-api
Change-Id: I1c1899fe213851caa029edacbe4d1142f6707978

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-23 18:13:07.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump falcon to 1.0.0

Having minimum version constraint for falcon>=0.1.6 in g-r and
1.1.0 in upper-constraints is not good.

Basically after release of falcon==0.0.3, the next one
was 1.0.0 and, as falcon documentation says
(http://falcon.readthedocs.io/en/stable/changes/1.0.0.html),
there were some breaking changes. However there are none for
1.1.0 release.

The issue was discovered during monasca-log-api testing with older
falcon and having problems with major falcon's API code differences.
Same issue affects monasca-api.

Ref-1: http://falcon.readthedocs.io/en/stable/changes/1.0.0.html

Change-Id: Ib521441d38fcff942e64a125cde2e0861c4abf4e
"}]
commit_message:
Bump falcon to 1.0.0

Having minimum version constraint for falcon>=0.1.6 in g-r and
1.1.0 in upper-constraints is not good.

Basically after release of falcon==0.0.3, the next one
was 1.0.0 and, as falcon documentation says
(http://falcon.readthedocs.io/en/stable/changes/1.0.0.html),
there were some breaking changes. However there are none for
1.1.0 release.

The issue was discovered during monasca-log-api testing with older
falcon and having problems with major falcon's API code differences.
Same issue affects monasca-api.

Ref-1: http://falcon.readthedocs.io/en/stable/changes/1.0.0.html

Change-Id: Ib521441d38fcff942e64a125cde2e0861c4abf4e

commit_message:
Deploy CI scenarios with Pacemaker

Pacemaker is now deployed by default and it would be great to have it
tested for all scenarios to deploy real environments used in production.

subject: Support list commands by group name keyword
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-23 04:13:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/module.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1666780-c10010e9061689d3.yaml', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/common/test_module.py', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/common/test_module.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/command.rst'], 'message': 'Support list commands by group name keyword

The output of current "command list" is so long, it's

they care about.

Add "--group <group-keyword>" option to filter the commands by group
name keyword, like: --group volume, list all openstack.volume.v2
(cinder) commands

commit_message:
Support list commands by group name keyword

The output of current "command list" is so long, it's
very difficult for users to find out the commands
they care about.

Add "--group <group-keyword>" option to filter the commands by group
name keyword, like: --group volume, list all openstack.volume.v2
(cinder) commands

That support the scenario that users need to know the current support
commands of some OpenStack services(nova, neutron, cinder and so on) in
OSC.

Change-Id: Id673042729ad36a0cac0b81fb31a3537c24f03fc
Closes-Bug: #1666780

in addCleanup, otherwise if the testcase fails, unpause_server
