commit_message:
Use method is_ipv6_enabled from oslo.utils

oslo.utils provides similar function[1] to check if ipv6 is supported.
Though Nova and oslo.utils implemented in different way. We can improve
the version of oslo.utils to make it suitable to other projects.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/d1e08f/oslo_utils/netutils.py#L170

Change-Id: Ieed03ab210bd95563fd7acac130d393d988df40d

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-24 02:19:55.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/api/controllers/routing.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/api/controllers/test_routing.py'], 'message': "Catch an exception on resource routing update

1. What is the problem
When resource routing needs to update its attribute
named pod_id, it will fail if the pod where the new pod_id
lays on doesn't exist. This update error was caught
through internal server error originally and it was not
detailed enough.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Dismiss this update request by giving a regular invalid
parameter error and tell the operator that the new pod
for resource routing should exist. The pod to which the
pod_id belongs can only be selected from the existing
pods. Because it is a foreign key and highly depends on
pod table. At the same time, we should add one test case
for this circumstance.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
None.

Change-Id: Iae6e3368c7f0ff0cd751aca932cba818328bb723
"}]
commit_message:
Catch an exception on resource routing update

1. What is the problem
When resource routing needs to update its attribute
named pod_id, it will fail if the pod where the new pod_id
lays on doesn't exist. This update error was caught
through internal server error originally and it was not
detailed enough.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Dismiss this update request by giving a regular invalid
parameter error and tell the operator that the new pod
for resource routing should exist. The pod to which the
pod_id belongs can only be selected from the existing
pods. Because it is a foreign key and highly depends on
pod table. At the same time, we should add one test case
for this circumstance.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
None.

Change-Id: Iae6e3368c7f0ff0cd751aca932cba818328bb723

Partial-Implements: blueprint support-ipv6-access

'}]
commit_message:
Address family neutrality for container driver

The container driver uses IPv4 specific techniques to fetch the
IP address from the container serving as share server when creating
a share.

Use a method instead for fetching the container IP address that works
with any address family.

Partial-Implements: blueprint support-ipv6-access

subject: Add support for indicating required floating IPs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 14:34:12.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/vendors/citycloud.json', 'os_client_config/vendors/rackspace.json', 'os_client_config/vendor-schema.json', 'os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/vendors/vexxhost.json', 'doc/source/vendor-support.rst', 'os_client_config/vendors/auro.json'], 'message': "Add support for indicating required floating IPs

Some clouds require that users add a floating IP to a server if the user
wants that server to be able to talk to things that are not on the
cloud. Some clouds do not require this and instead give servers a
directly attached IP. The only way a user can know is to boot a server,
then ask neutron for the port associated with that server, then find the
network the port came from and then try to infer whether or not that
network has the ability to route packets northbound. Of course, networks
don't actually communicate that quality directly, (router:external
doesn't mean a network routes externally, it means the network can have
a router attached to it to provide floating ips) so it's still hit and
miss.

Where we can, save the user the stress and strain of not knowing how
their cloud wants them to get an externally routable IP.

Change-Id: I1baf804ce28bc1997b2347c4648c5cc56c750ead
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for indicating required floating IPs

Some clouds require that users add a floating IP to a server if the user
wants that server to be able to talk to things that are not on the
cloud. Some clouds do not require this and instead give servers a
directly attached IP. The only way a user can know is to boot a server,
then ask neutron for the port associated with that server, then find the
network the port came from and then try to infer whether or not that
network has the ability to route packets northbound. Of course, networks
don't actually communicate that quality directly, (router:external
doesn't mean a network routes externally, it means the network can have
a router attached to it to provide floating ips) so it's still hit and
miss.

Where we can, save the user the stress and strain of not knowing how
their cloud wants them to get an externally routable IP.

Change-Id: I1baf804ce28bc1997b2347c4648c5cc56c750ead

subject: KEEP_LOCALRC for barbican-tempest-plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-27 00:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml'], 'message': 'KEEP_LOCALRC for barbican-tempest-plugin

With the recent modifications to merge local.conf and localrc,
setting local.conf values in the pre_test_hook.sh get overwritten
unless KEEP_LOCALRC is set to 1.

It is understood that setting configuration options via
DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG is preferable, but it is beneficial to
be able to test configuration options alongside the change
being proposed.

Change-Id: Ib06ae8aa890d09ac2cd9e3bf4bfd45440618dcc2
'}]
commit_message:
KEEP_LOCALRC for barbican-tempest-plugin

With the recent modifications to merge local.conf and localrc,
setting local.conf values in the pre_test_hook.sh get overwritten
unless KEEP_LOCALRC is set to 1.

It is understood that setting configuration options via
DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG is preferable, but it is beneficial to
be able to test configuration options alongside the change
being proposed.

Change-Id: Ib06ae8aa890d09ac2cd9e3bf4bfd45440618dcc2

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded instances of `stack` from roles

We are moving away from hardcoding the stack user and opting to
replace it with `undercloud_user` and `non_root_user` as appropriate
to increase flexibility of OOOQ and OOOQ-Extras.

Change-Id: I7ea43a3fabab2c69fd4f3b5550ea5e4627443406

subject: Change sandbox flavor from 'm1.small' to 'm1.tiny'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-25 10:27:40.000000000', 'files': ['zun/container/docker/driver.py', 'zun/tests/unit/container/docker/test_docker_driver.py'], 'message': "Change sandbox flavor from 'm1.small' to 'm1.tiny'

Current nova flavor used for sandbox in nova docker driver is
'm1.small', this consumes much resources and we may not be able
to create many containers on low configuration machines. Since sandbox
container does no processing, we may restrict it to 'm1.tiny'. This change
will not impact user's container since sandbox container and user's container
do not share same cgroups.

Change-Id: Ia0c6ff3efecb48a14e137407ce8a0c349f9e5290
"}]
commit_message:
Change sandbox flavor from 'm1.small' to 'm1.tiny'

Current nova flavor used for sandbox in nova docker driver is
'm1.small', this consumes much resources and we may not be able
to create many containers on low configuration machines. Since sandbox
container does no processing, we may restrict it to 'm1.tiny'. This change
will not impact user's container since sandbox container and user's container
do not share same cgroups.

Change-Id: Ia0c6ff3efecb48a14e137407ce8a0c349f9e5290

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-02-08 17:39:21.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Remove redundant bdm serial mangling and saving during swap_volume

During an initial swap_volume call the serial of the original volume was
previously stashed in the connection_info of the new volume by the
compute layer. This was used by I19d5182d11 to allow the virt driver to
lookup and update the existing BDM with the new volume's connection_info
after it had been used by connect_volume.

Future calls to swap_volume in the compute layer would not
update the serial found in the old volume connection_info. This would
result in an invalid serial being copied into the new volume
connection_info and used to preform a lookup of a BDM that didn't exist.

To correct this we now explicitly set the serial of the new volume to
that of the new volume id. While the correct serial id should already be
present in the connection_info provided by most backend Cinder volume
drivers the act of updating this dict is required by our own functional
tests to invoke a failure case :

https://git.io/vDmRE

The serial is updated once more to match the volume id returned
by os-migrate-volume-completion prior to the BDM being updated in the
compute layer.

The BDM lookup and save from the virt layer is also removed as the
compute layer retains a reference to new_cinfo and will update the BDM
with this, including any modifications, at the end of swap_volume.

Finally, the associated Tempest admin test is also extended by the
following change to now attempt a second volume swap to verify these
changes :

I2a2c80a164b9f75d0e7e0503a24194bedfc0e66b

Closes-bug: #1661016
Change-Id: If74dd9d8e7191047b6f1cd7e35b6fc667f004f91

commit_message:
Rally job for ml2

This patchs enables rally jobs for midonet with ml2.
It changes the project names, using templates
instead of hardcoded names.
Rally jobs are going to run only on newton or newer versions,
because it's not planned to do any work in performance for
previous versions.

Closes-Bug: #1650255

Change-Id: I47fa94a97dfe6ece6b7197df2871cd8738d55cf4
Signed-off-by: Antonio Ojea <aojea@midokura.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-21 15:05:21.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml'], 'message': "Enable swift in the Heat gate all the time

We're skipping swift in the Heat integration tests when using python3,

Change-Id: I044bc0536d728965f9637a344325d2d9763e471f

commit_message:
Enable swift in the Heat gate all the time

We're skipping swift in the Heat integration tests when using python3,
but there is no reason to, as devstack ought to use python2 if swift
doesn't declare python3 support.

Change-Id: I044bc0536d728965f9637a344325d2d9763e471f

subject: ironic: Put initial GRENADE_PLUGINRC in ironic-vars-early
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 21:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': "ironic: Put initial GRENADE_PLUGINRC in ironic-vars-early

Put the initial GRENADE_PLUGINRC in ironic-vars-early so that way we
don't need to be as careful with ordering when creating a job.

For example this will allow the following to work:
    builders:
      - ...
      - ironic-grenade-multitenant
      - ironic-grenade
      - ...

Change-Id: Icb8e2c53b576db1dfe190157449e3783c2dff020
"}]
commit_message:
ironic: Put initial GRENADE_PLUGINRC in ironic-vars-early

Put the initial GRENADE_PLUGINRC in ironic-vars-early so that way we
don't need to be as careful with ordering when creating a job.

For example this will allow the following to work:
    builders:
      - ...
      - ironic-grenade-multitenant
      - ironic-grenade
      - ...

Change-Id: Icb8e2c53b576db1dfe190157449e3783c2dff020

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-25 15:26:57.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "tripleo: implement upgrade scenarios

We tested tripleo-scenario001-upgrades and it now works.
This patch:
- implement the same jobs for scenario002, 003 and 004.
- move the jobs to the check pipeline in THT, non-voting.
- relax the regex so upgrade jobs are only run when touching the
  right files, so we don't waste resources.

Change-Id: I3df771d98adffde272df94661fcc31aec4661fde
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo: implement upgrade scenarios

We tested tripleo-scenario001-upgrades and it now works.
This patch:
- implement the same jobs for scenario002, 003 and 004.
- move the jobs to the check pipeline in THT, non-voting.
- relax the regex so upgrade jobs are only run when touching the
  right files, so we don't waste resources.

Change-Id: I3df771d98adffde272df94661fcc31aec4661fde

subject: Install barbican-tempest-plugin through local config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 16:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/barbican.yaml'], 'message': 'Install barbican-tempest-plugin through local config

Previously, barbican-tempest-plugin was installed every time the
barbican devstack plugin was enabled, which was breaking things for
other projects that were trying to use barbican in their tests, but
not run the barbican tempest tests themselves (see
Iabbdc5177f62514bf5fc4dff5b79ba3c11083506). This is the first step
to explicitly install the barbican-tempest-plugin where the tests
are wanted.

Change-Id: Ibef3f9a135f14727bf57c29e766f838d7da56c68
Co-Authored-By: Brianna Poulos <Brianna.Poulos@jhuapl.edu>
'}]
commit_message:
Install barbican-tempest-plugin through local config

Previously, barbican-tempest-plugin was installed every time the
barbican devstack plugin was enabled, which was breaking things for
other projects that were trying to use barbican in their tests, but
not run the barbican tempest tests themselves (see
Iabbdc5177f62514bf5fc4dff5b79ba3c11083506). This is the first step
to explicitly install the barbican-tempest-plugin where the tests
are wanted.

Change-Id: Ibef3f9a135f14727bf57c29e766f838d7da56c68
Co-Authored-By: Brianna Poulos <Brianna.Poulos@jhuapl.edu>

This adds some sugar to allow subscription to resources via
a decorator directly on a method as it is defined in a class.

This will allow us to stop overriding __new__ everywhere for

commit_message:
Registry decorator to bring subscribes to methods

This adds some sugar to allow subscription to resources via
a decorator directly on a method as it is defined in a class.

This will allow us to stop overriding __new__ everywhere for
subscriptions and will allow the fact that a method is subscribed
to a resource to be visible right above the method itself.

See the follow-up patch[1] for an example of how this can clean
things up.
1. I764be99b2edbd0e7b54673c1940e883d7f313bf5

Change-Id: I1020c5ddec57f535e5b94f803144dfa19d668937

commit_message:
Allow scheduler to run cell host discovery periodically

Since cellsv2 has required host mappings to be present, we have lost
our automatic host registration behavior. This is a conscious choice,
given that we do not want to have upcalls from the cells to the API
database. This adds a periodic task to have the scheduler do the
discovery routine, which for small deployments may be an acceptable
amount of background overhead in exchange for the automatic behavior.

There is also probably some amount of performance improvement that
can be added to the host discovery routine to make it less of an
issue. However, just generalizing the existing routine and letting
it run periodically gives us some coverage, given where we are in
the current cycle.

Related to blueprint cells-scheduler-integration

Change-Id: Iab5f172cdef35645bae56b9b384e032f3160e826

commit_message:
Fix OVSBridge.delete_flows when called with no args

With this change calling delete_flows with no kwargs will (instead
of resulting in calling "ovs-ofctl <action> <bridge> -", which does
nothing with no flow spec given on stdin) result in calling
"ovs-ofctl <action> <bridge>", which will delete all flows.

This aligns the behavior of delete_flows with the behavior currently seen by
all callers for the same method shadowed by the implementations in
OpenFlowSwitchMixin classes.

Change-Id: Ic0449acb3a0d4915ce025300d6f3c507a3cd8e48
Closes-Bug: 1658019

commit_message:
Cleanup _find_related_obj

All of the additional lookup logic was essentially duplicating
a relationship property of 'load_on_pending=True', which tells
SQLAlchemy to lookup the relationship during object creation [1].
So we can dump all of this logic and just use that option.

1. http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/relationship_api.html
   #sqlalchemy.orm.relationship.params.load_on_pending

Related: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: I0e495a50f5cab9b6449825039d7683d77de1e763

commit_message:
Check event type is supported before publishing

Currently, ceilometer converts all notification into an Event and
sends them to pipelines where there are filtered. In this patch
notifications will be filtered before they will be converted into
an Event to speed this process.

Change-Id: I89e4e238441891e628fd13d6dafc46600b2484bc
Related-Bug: #1432855

subject: DF L3 service plugin does not need agent RPC
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-21 02:17:45.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/neutron/services/l3_router_plugin.py'], 'message': "DF L3 service plugin does not need agent RPC

The DF L3 service plugin inherits from the neutron
ExtraRoute_db_mixin and L3_NAT_db_mixin class which
eventually inherits from the neutron L3RpcNotifierMixin
class. The L3RpcNotifierMixin inheritance isn't
necessary and adds unneeded RPC overhead since the DF
L3 service plugin doesn't use an L3 agent RPC.

Change-Id: I6f0fc1e6e7250d62b6a77eecd63576d9c37f6bfc
"}]
commit_message:
DF L3 service plugin does not need agent RPC

The DF L3 service plugin inherits from the neutron
ExtraRoute_db_mixin and L3_NAT_db_mixin class which
eventually inherits from the neutron L3RpcNotifierMixin
class. The L3RpcNotifierMixin inheritance isn't
necessary and adds unneeded RPC overhead since the DF
L3 service plugin doesn't use an L3 agent RPC.

Change-Id: I6f0fc1e6e7250d62b6a77eecd63576d9c37f6bfc

subject: PortSec App to match by reg6 and not in_port
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-24 10:29:35.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/portsec_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_portsec_flows.py'], 'message': 'PortSec App to match by reg6 and not in_port

Currently, Port Security application recognises a logical port by its ofport.
If logical ports will share an ofport (as in the case of VLAN aware
VMs), this will not work correctly.

This change has Port Security recognise a logical port by reg6, which is
set to that ports unique key in the classification app. Different ports
will have different unique IDs.

Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk
Change-Id: I86594a1f61f622251284799d76410e3caf03ec3e
'}]
commit_message:
PortSec App to match by reg6 and not in_port

Currently, Port Security application recognises a logical port by its ofport.
If logical ports will share an ofport (as in the case of VLAN aware
VMs), this will not work correctly.

This change has Port Security recognise a logical port by reg6, which is
set to that ports unique key in the classification app. Different ports
will have different unique IDs.

Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk
Change-Id: I86594a1f61f622251284799d76410e3caf03ec3e

subject: DNAT app to use unique_key for ICMP packets
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-25 11:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/dnat_app.py'], 'message': "DNAT app to use unique_key for ICMP packets

The DNAT application uses packet-in events for handling ICMP packets,
and then sending them out to the VM directly using the VM's openflow port.

This change modifies that behaviour, that the DNAT application will
dispatch the packet to the logical port rather than the openflow
port. This will allow support for cases where multiple logical ports
reside on the same openflow port, e.g. VLAN aware VMs.

Change-Id: Id95b230744f126fb420521f88dcb391d8cb4c7dc
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk
"}]
commit_message:
DNAT app to use unique_key for ICMP packets

The DNAT application uses packet-in events for handling ICMP packets,
and then sending them out to the VM directly using the VM's openflow port.

This change modifies that behaviour, that the DNAT application will
dispatch the packet to the logical port rather than the openflow
port. This will allow support for cases where multiple logical ports
reside on the same openflow port, e.g. VLAN aware VMs.

Change-Id: Id95b230744f126fb420521f88dcb391d8cb4c7dc
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk

subject: Metadata to use unique_key rather than in_port
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-25 11:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/metadata_service_app.py'], 'message': "Metadata to use unique_key rather than in_port

In the current implementation, the metadata service uses learned flows to
return packets returned from the metadata service directly to the original
openflow port from which they originated.

This is problematic in case there are multiple logical ports on a single
openflow port, e.g. when using VLAN aware VMs.

In this change, packets returned from the metadata service have reg7
encoded with the logical port's unique key, and then sent to the
dispatch table for further processing.

Change-Id: I31c482aec1a09c32907a752addd7170f305a74eb
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk
"}]
commit_message:
Metadata to use unique_key rather than in_port

In the current implementation, the metadata service uses learned flows to
return packets returned from the metadata service directly to the original
openflow port from which they originated.

This is problematic in case there are multiple logical ports on a single
openflow port, e.g. when using VLAN aware VMs.

In this change, packets returned from the metadata service have reg7
encoded with the logical port's unique key, and then sent to the
dispatch table for further processing.

Change-Id: I31c482aec1a09c32907a752addd7170f305a74eb
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk

Canonical now stores "*.img" images in the directories where we look
for newer ISO images ("*.img") when our standard ISO image has been
removed.

Change-Id: Ic7e73f469a20ee16b532696dd664f8be7446fb26
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ISO URL update for Ubuntu

Canonical now stores "*.img" images in the directories where we look
for newer ISO images ("*.img") when our standard ISO image has been
removed.

This patch fixes the update code for osbash to find the correct ISO
image if an IMG is present.

Change-Id: Ic7e73f469a20ee16b532696dd664f8be7446fb26

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-20 03:13:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Ensure we mark baremetal links as phy links

In the Ironic multi-tenant case, the neutron ports will remain unbound
until later in the deploy process. Nova generates the network_data.json
file with all the links marked as unbound, which we need to correct as
these links will be bound after the config drive is generated and
written to the node. This patch updates the Ironic virt driver to
correct the network metadata.

Change-Id: I1881f4a9bca6a6d6a3b4e0e89a82b0765ae09eee
Closes-Bug: #1656854
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure we mark baremetal links as phy links

In the Ironic multi-tenant case, the neutron ports will remain unbound
until later in the deploy process. Nova generates the network_data.json
file with all the links marked as unbound, which we need to correct as
these links will be bound after the config drive is generated and
written to the node. This patch updates the Ironic virt driver to
correct the network metadata.

Change-Id: I1881f4a9bca6a6d6a3b4e0e89a82b0765ae09eee
Closes-Bug: #1656854

Commit I66d1cfad7c37215cadeca9b7d07cb646fb35b50f removed the constraint

commit_message:
Block starting compute unless placement conf is provided

We need to signal that the compute is Ocata and since the placement is now
mandatory for Ocata, we want to hard-fail if the conf is not correct.

Depends-On: I573149b9415da2a8bb3951a4c4ce71c4c3e48c6f
Change-Id: I3919f652040f2be2641420dd469af01b268e65c9

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-01-18 23:06:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py'], 'message': 'Strict pattern match query parameters

We have a lot of filters are pattern match.

There is list for exact match
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/df2fd4a252cecc1e1ef471c071e57526ddf65499/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2221

Out of that list will be pattern match

Closes-Bug: #1653899

Change-Id: I4cf38407c20284dee7127edfe312da81caac9272
'}]
commit_message:
Strict pattern match query parameters

We have a lot of filters are pattern match.

There is list for exact match
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/df2fd4a252cecc1e1ef471c071e57526ddf65499/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2221

Out of that list will be pattern match
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/df2fd4a252cecc1e1ef471c071e57526ddf65499/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2231

HTTP 500 raises if invalid regex provided for
those filters, strict there format to be regex
in JSON schema to avoid this.

partial implement of bp add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters
Closes-Bug: #1653899

Change-Id: I4cf38407c20284dee7127edfe312da81caac9272

commit_message:
Add InstanceMappingList.get_by_cell_id

This adds the InstanceMappingList.get_by_cell_id method which will
provide a way to list InstanceMappings by a given CellMapping.id. This
is going to be used later in a "nova-manage cell_v2 delete_cell"
command.

Change-Id: I98a22161b28f2de32760c578713be27766e6809e

commit_message:
Use userrc_early for all nodes

Instead of only using the userrc_early when keystone
is an enabled service we will do it on all runs of
stack.sh. This way services can be split up more
across devstack nodes, and you can do configuration
requiring credentials on nodes that don't install
keystone.

Change-Id: I74574ae9f45a74bcbcc8e3149228ecb795ab4fb7
(cherry picked from commit a5d965a3d7c558239d770428e1dd815943a8d887)

commit_message:
Fix gate: caused by tempest(removal of "service" param)

Tempest removed "service" param from Manager class in
following patch:-
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/416699

The use of "service" param is removed with this patch.

Note: Backported straight from stable/ocata since this change
is already part of 73212dbe39fd3e8b3a57dfac82a441ef1ab862c4 in
stable/newton.

(cherry picked from commit 6950c34045360544a73d316b0017c06abd8bf4cd)

Fix mesos gate

Use DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG istead of localrc to pass
MAGNUM_IMAGE_URL.

Conflicts:
	magnum/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh
(cherry picked from commit fb67f87f12b3a393c586ca99802fe076d024f53b)

Co-Authored-By: Johannes Grassler <johannes.grassler@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: yatin <yatin.karel@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I67f79efd2049c05d36ea56691b664417ed358fd8

subject: Fix binary ironic-inspector rootwrap configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 13:29:37.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ironic/ironic-inspector/ironic_sudoers_source', 'docker/ironic/ironic-inspector/ironic_sudoers_binary', 'docker/ironic/ironic-inspector/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Fix binary ironic-inspector rootwrap configuration

When built with the binary install type (at least on CentOS), Ironic
inspector fails to start and the container remains in a restarting
state. The log file shows that it is failing to execute iptables, and
analysis found that this was due to an incorrect rootwrap
configuration. The RDO ironic inspector RPM expects Ironic inspector
to be run as the ironic-inspector user, however Kolla uses the ironic
user. This means that neither of the packaged ironic nor
ironic-inspector sudoers configuration files works for us.

Kolla currently installs a sudoers file pointing to the rootwrap
script in the virtualenv of the source install, but of course this
only makes sense for source installs, and should not be installed for
binary installs.

This change adds a second sudoers file that will work for the binary
install type, and installs the correct sudoers file for the install
type.

Change-Id: I8ecd0b658b8df8f38ddf717fa9443d4dc2896984
Closes-Bug: #1624457
'}]
commit_message:
Fix binary ironic-inspector rootwrap configuration

When built with the binary install type (at least on CentOS), Ironic
inspector fails to start and the container remains in a restarting
state. The log file shows that it is failing to execute iptables, and
analysis found that this was due to an incorrect rootwrap
configuration. The RDO ironic inspector RPM expects Ironic inspector
to be run as the ironic-inspector user, however Kolla uses the ironic
user. This means that neither of the packaged ironic nor
ironic-inspector sudoers configuration files works for us.

Kolla currently installs a sudoers file pointing to the rootwrap
script in the virtualenv of the source install, but of course this
only makes sense for source installs, and should not be installed for
binary installs.

This change adds a second sudoers file that will work for the binary
install type, and installs the correct sudoers file for the install
type.

Change-Id: I8ecd0b658b8df8f38ddf717fa9443d4dc2896984
Closes-Bug: #1624457

of "ara generate html". "ara generate" will be removed sometime in
the future so let's adjust it right away.

commit_message:
api-ref: Fix path parameters in os-hypervisors.inc

The hypervisor ID in path parameters have been fixed to 'integer'.
In "Search Hypervisor" and "List Hypervisor Servers",
the hypervisor IDs have been fixed to a string for searching
hypervisor host names.

Change-Id: I2260f0c4ca82d5a2ae5a46bcf8f48f9eaaf09f2f
Closes-Bug: #1654197

commit_message:
libvirt: expose virtual interfaces with vlans to metadata

Enhance the _build_device_metadata method to expose virtual interface with vlan
to the devices metadata. Previously, only interfaces with tags could be
exposed.

Implements: blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port-vlan
Change-Id: I7abf16b996bd68aa7fa1e3a121eae3147a244284

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 22752, 'name': 'Hanxi Liu', 'email': 'apolloliuhx@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hanxi_Liu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-23 09:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "tests: don't run functional tests in parallel

kafka doesn't play well with //, each times a new partition/topic is
created, kafka rebalances things across brokers and messages are not
delivered at the expected time.

So this change disable the parallelizism for functional tests for kafka
only.

Change-Id: Ia497334efcd4685850ac1529a7fc38073dae7cd1
"}]
commit_message:
tests: don't run functional tests in parallel

kafka doesn't play well with //, each times a new partition/topic is
created, kafka rebalances things across brokers and messages are not
delivered at the expected time.

So this change disable the parallelizism for functional tests for kafka
only.

Change-Id: Ia497334efcd4685850ac1529a7fc38073dae7cd1

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-23 07:47:00.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/openvswitch_agent'], 'message': "XenAPI: enable root_helper_daemon for XenServer

The daemon mode of root helper for XenAPI has been implemented by
this change which has been merged to neutron:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390931/
It will help to import the performance. Let's enable this mode
by default in devstack.

Change-Id: I52246bef3e4434dfc49446535b122580bc475ac3
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: enable root_helper_daemon for XenServer

The daemon mode of root helper for XenAPI has been implemented by
this change which has been merged to neutron:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390931/
It will help to import the performance. Let's enable this mode
by default in devstack.

Change-Id: I52246bef3e4434dfc49446535b122580bc475ac3

subject: add tool for verifying late releases are on the right branch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 16:09:42.000000000', 'files': ['tools/verify_branches_and_late_releases.py', 'openstack_releases/gitutils.py'], 'message': 'add tool for verifying late releases are on the right branch

We had at one case where the release validation logic failed to catch a
release from master after the stable/ocata branch was created for
mox3. This script looks at the other "late" releases, created after a
branch, and verifies that they are all on the correct branch.

Change-Id: Ie148a34efa029e6715db099f7e5c9575ed94238d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add tool for verifying late releases are on the right branch

We had at one case where the release validation logic failed to catch a
release from master after the stable/ocata branch was created for
mox3. This script looks at the other "late" releases, created after a
branch, and verifies that they are all on the correct branch.

Change-Id: Ie148a34efa029e6715db099f7e5c9575ed94238d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: improve instructions for defining deliverable and picking version numbers

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-13 18:16:38.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': 'improve instructions for defining deliverable and picking version numbers

Add detail about how to define a deliverable based on how the project is
managed rather than technical criteria.

Move the information about assigning version numbers up to the "how to"
section instead of the reviewer section to make it more likely that
submitters will read it.

Change-Id: I480e91ae69f91b2e87ed83fe343dc546948f31f5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
improve instructions for defining deliverable and picking version numbers

Add detail about how to define a deliverable based on how the project is
managed rather than technical criteria.

Move the information about assigning version numbers up to the "how to"
section instead of the reviewer section to make it more likely that
submitters will read it.

Change-Id: I480e91ae69f91b2e87ed83fe343dc546948f31f5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: check stable branch name against current series
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 22:31:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/tests/test_validate.py', 'openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py'], 'message': 'check stable branch name against current series

For cycle-based projects, require the stable branch name to match the
current series. For independent projects, require the stable branch name
to match *a* series.

Change-Id: I25f7b5b0472e5349863ebea94b635daa3ec6d5dc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
check stable branch name against current series

For cycle-based projects, require the stable branch name to match the
current series. For independent projects, require the stable branch name
to match *a* series.

Change-Id: I25f7b5b0472e5349863ebea94b635daa3ec6d5dc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add a series argument to tag_history_from_git
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 16:43:37.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tag_history_from_git.py'], 'message': 'Add a series argument to tag_history_from_git

When importing history for an independant project currently
tag_history_from_git will create the file in
deliverables/UNKNOWN/$project.yaml.  Add a series argument so the file
can be created in the correct directory.

Change-Id: I22c840d1b46624bfdef8add09718c4dc4e489917
'}]
commit_message:
Add a series argument to tag_history_from_git

When importing history for an independant project currently
tag_history_from_git will create the file in
deliverables/UNKNOWN/$project.yaml.  Add a series argument so the file
can be created in the correct directory.

Change-Id: I22c840d1b46624bfdef8add09718c4dc4e489917

all of the neutron subprojects at the same time.

commit_message:
Murano tests - Categories

Added Murano tests for categories.

Ported over base murano test classes from murano and changed
the inheritance so that setup_clients is automatically called
by Tempest -- a classmethod which is needed by Patrole.

Change-Id: Ia967b068ea57bb3cd85fc17da003d42d53097762
Partially-implements: blueprint initial-tests-app-cat
Co-Authored-By: Samantha Blanco <samantha.blanco@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Purcell <david.purcell@att.com>

Add parameter 'dnsmasq_ip_subnets' and enable template to

additional subnets in Ironic Inspector dnsmasq.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-ironic-inspector
Closes-Bug: #1637503
Change-Id: Ie49b07ffe948576f5d9330cf11ee014aef4b282d

commit_message:
Multiple DHCP Subnets for Ironic Inspector

Add parameter 'dnsmasq_ip_subnets' and enable template to
configure dhcp-range and dhcp-option 'option:router' for
additional subnets in Ironic Inspector dnsmasq.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-ironic-inspector
Closes-Bug: #1637503
Change-Id: Ie49b07ffe948576f5d9330cf11ee014aef4b282d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 02:07:08.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/testing.rst'], 'message': 'Expand description of test types

The test type descriptions included in the devref were not enough
to avoid confusion when deciding where new tests should go.

This expands the descriptions to help make it easier to recognize
which category a test should belong in.

Change-Id: Ic99650b8f11670b52f9d54297df20f85f2fb16a9
'}]
commit_message:
Expand description of test types

The test type descriptions included in the devref were not enough
to avoid confusion when deciding where new tests should go.

This expands the descriptions to help make it easier to recognize
which category a test should belong in.

Change-Id: Ic99650b8f11670b52f9d54297df20f85f2fb16a9

* attestation_auth_timeout

commit_message:
conf: add min parameter to scheduler opts

Added min parameter to two scheduler's configuration options:
* max_instances_per_host
* attestation_auth_timeout
and removed coresponding warning messages from the code base.

Change-Id: I873e8217bbddf376f642ee735613035a777b5051
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike

subject: Logrotate not restarting rsyslog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-25 16:42:11.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Logrotate not restarting rsyslog

logrotate is not sending HUP signal to rsyslog because of invalid
command in postrotate/endscript block. Fixed the command to reloadr
the rsyslog after the logs are rotated.

Change-Id: I483c82ff614ad3ce8d6daa622f61a794bd26f2be
'}]
commit_message:
Logrotate not restarting rsyslog

logrotate is not sending HUP signal to rsyslog because of invalid
command in postrotate/endscript block. Fixed the command to reloadr
the rsyslog after the logs are rotated.

Change-Id: I483c82ff614ad3ce8d6daa622f61a794bd26f2be

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-27 19:15:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Added instance.reboot.error to the legacy notifications

reboot.error is being transformed to use versioned notifications [1].
But in the tests, we are getting an error, as
compute.instance.reboot.error is not added to the allowed legacy
notifications.

However, this legacy notification exists [2] for a long time,
it was updated in 2013. [3]

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411791
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L3024
[3]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/f35c63df24d8f47927d055729e9ca08c7bc3fe8c

commit_message:
Added instance.reboot.error to the legacy notifications

reboot.error is being transformed to use versioned notifications [1].
But in the tests, we are getting an error, as
compute.instance.reboot.error is not added to the allowed legacy
notifications.

However, this legacy notification exists [2] for a long time,
it was updated in 2013. [3]

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411791
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L3024
[3]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/f35c63df24d8f47927d055729e9ca08c7bc3fe8c

Change-Id: I1ce3deff1894bddb4cde5c3362b1d92816d7b2ca

commit_message:
Fixes for race condition when adding primitives without OCF present

* Change the servie "status" to report "stopped" if the
  primitive has failures on the node.
* Enable "status" failure check.
* Support error detection for a missing OCF monitor operations.
* Add operations status debug method
* Add forgotten cib_reset to the wait_for_online

Change-Id: I34fbf8b4a7d2420fb568719f473bc9b40063cc82

subject: Fix test status indication
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-18 19:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/tools/repeat-test.sh', 'labs/osbash/tools/test-once.sh'], 'message': 'Fix test status indication

When test scripts fail, repeat-test incorrectly logs "Test passed".

This patch makes test-once pass on the return status it got from the
test script. This is not sufficient for repeat-test to receive the error
(a pipe to tee eats the return status). For now, this patch uses a
simple solution: we grep the test log file for the actual return status.

Change-Id: I22ee768c4634e25e2a3f9154cf9a3cd69c2e0250
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test status indication

When test scripts fail, repeat-test incorrectly logs "Test passed".

This patch makes test-once pass on the return status it got from the
test script. This is not sufficient for repeat-test to receive the error
(a pipe to tee eats the return status). For now, this patch uses a
simple solution: we grep the test log file for the actual return status.

Change-Id: I22ee768c4634e25e2a3f9154cf9a3cd69c2e0250

subject: Remove distro support based on new libvirt minimum
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-13 21:32:26.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common', 'stack.sh'], 'message': 'Remove distro support based on new libvirt minimum

Nova is going to increase the minimum required libvirt
in Pike to 1.2.9 in change:

I9a972e3fde2e4e552f6fc98350820c07873c3de3

Based on the libvirt distro support matrix wiki [1] that
drops support for Ubuntu Trusty and Debian 7.0/Wheezy.

Trusty has libvirt 1.2.2 and Wheezy has 0.9.12 (the Wheezy
support should have been removed long ago apparently). The
7.0 removed here is for Wheezy also based on commit
b2ef890db3d78b24f9da2f4dd80502165c669ad0.

This does not undo the check for "trusty" with the
EBTABLES_RACE_FIX in lib/nova_plugins/function-libvirt
since you can still force devstack to run on Trusty if
you specify the FORCE=yes variable.

Note that RHEL 7.1 has libvirt 1.2.8 so it won't technically
work with devstack and nova + pike + libvirt, but with the
way os_RELEASE is calculated the minor version is dropped
for RHEL distros so we just get "rhel7".

Also note that this doesn't attempt to continue supporting
Trusty or Wheezy if nova is not configured to use libvirt,
simply in order to start moving forward on devstack distro
support in general and to keep some sanity and closeness
to what we test with in the CI system.

While we're in here, we also drop Fedora 23 and add
Ubuntu Zesty.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Depends-On: I9a972e3fde2e4e552f6fc98350820c07873c3de3
Depends-On: If69f99bd789e646b0261e27a8a061efde32436f7

Change-Id: I6617283afd798af37e64913b7865cea3c8a62aba
'}]
commit_message:
Remove distro support based on new libvirt minimum

Nova is going to increase the minimum required libvirt
in Pike to 1.2.9 in change:

I9a972e3fde2e4e552f6fc98350820c07873c3de3

Based on the libvirt distro support matrix wiki [1] that
drops support for Ubuntu Trusty and Debian 7.0/Wheezy.

Trusty has libvirt 1.2.2 and Wheezy has 0.9.12 (the Wheezy
support should have been removed long ago apparently). The
7.0 removed here is for Wheezy also based on commit
b2ef890db3d78b24f9da2f4dd80502165c669ad0.

This does not undo the check for "trusty" with the
EBTABLES_RACE_FIX in lib/nova_plugins/function-libvirt
since you can still force devstack to run on Trusty if
you specify the FORCE=yes variable.

Note that RHEL 7.1 has libvirt 1.2.8 so it won't technically
work with devstack and nova + pike + libvirt, but with the
way os_RELEASE is calculated the minor version is dropped
for RHEL distros so we just get "rhel7".

Also note that this doesn't attempt to continue supporting
Trusty or Wheezy if nova is not configured to use libvirt,
simply in order to start moving forward on devstack distro
support in general and to keep some sanity and closeness
to what we test with in the CI system.

While we're in here, we also drop Fedora 23 and add
Ubuntu Zesty.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Depends-On: I9a972e3fde2e4e552f6fc98350820c07873c3de3
Depends-On: If69f99bd789e646b0261e27a8a061efde32436f7

Change-Id: I6617283afd798af37e64913b7865cea3c8a62aba

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-08 22:08:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/block_device_mapping.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_block_device_mapping.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1662699-06203e7262e02aa6.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow None for block_device_mapping_v2.boot_index

The legacy v2 API allowed None for the boot_index [1]. It
allowed this implicitly because the API code would convert
the block_device_mapping_v2 dict from the request into a
BlockDeviceMapping object, which has a boot_index field that
is nullable (allows None).

The API reference documentation [2] also says:

"To disable a device from booting, set the boot index
to a negative value or use the default boot index value,
which is None."

It appears that with the move to v2.1 and request schema
validation, the boot_index schema was erroneously set to
not allow None for a value, which is not backward compatible
with the v2 API behavior.

This change fixes the schema to allow boot_index=None again
and adds a test to show it working.

This should not require a microversion bump since it's fixing
a regression in the v2.1 API which worked in the v2 API and
is already handled throughout Nova's block device code.

Closes-Bug: #1662699

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0/nova/compute/api.py#L1268
[2] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-server

Change-Id: Ice78a0982bcce491f0c9690903ed2c6b6aaab1be
'}]
commit_message:
Allow None for block_device_mapping_v2.boot_index

The legacy v2 API allowed None for the boot_index [1]. It
allowed this implicitly because the API code would convert
the block_device_mapping_v2 dict from the request into a
BlockDeviceMapping object, which has a boot_index field that
is nullable (allows None).

The API reference documentation [2] also says:

"To disable a device from booting, set the boot index
to a negative value or use the default boot index value,
which is None."

It appears that with the move to v2.1 and request schema
validation, the boot_index schema was erroneously set to
not allow None for a value, which is not backward compatible
with the v2 API behavior.

This change fixes the schema to allow boot_index=None again
and adds a test to show it working.

This should not require a microversion bump since it's fixing
a regression in the v2.1 API which worked in the v2 API and
is already handled throughout Nova's block device code.

Closes-Bug: #1662699

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0/nova/compute/api.py#L1268
[2] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-server

Change-Id: Ice78a0982bcce491f0c9690903ed2c6b6aaab1be

commit_message:
Allow integer port in os_transport_url

Currently we only allow to use strings
as the data type for ports.

Due to this we need to cast the data type
in the puppet modules because from THT
this is configured as a Number.

This submission allow to use either string
or numbers for the port parameter in the
os_transport_url function.

Change-Id: I9e56f8e2de542b20fe9e6995506cff5bb435e220
Closes-Bug: #1664561
(cherry picked from commit b3d0590022717c50be02dda0b1283ae3c4312206)

commit_message:
gate-hook: Accomodate devstack-gate local.conf changes

With devstack-gate switching to local.conf we can no longer use bash for
evaluating settings variables. Also we shouldn't populate local.conf
directly and let devstack-gate do that.

Since now devstack never uses localrc file directly, we set [[localrc]]
sections for local.conf instead.

As a nice side effect, it will make the gate hook work with devstack
that may not have the Ie571b5fa5a33d9ed09f30ba7c7724b958ce17616 in
(Newton and below), which may make backports easier later.

Change-Id: Ibe640a584add3acc89520a2bbb25b6f4c5818e1b
Closes-bug: 1667331

commit_message:
Avoid multiple initializations of Host class

nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host class manages nova interaction with
libvirtd. During processing of HUP signal, object of this class
could be initialized multiple times. This leads to resource leak
(pipes and threads) and the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/poll.py",
line 115, in wait
    listener.cb(fileno)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/greenthread.py",
line 214, in main
    result = function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/utils.py", line 1053, in context_wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/host.py", line 131, in
_dispatch_thread
    self._dispatch_events()
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/libvirt/host.py", line 236, in
_dispatch_events

This commit avoids multiple initializations of the same Host object.
Thus it fixes the above problems.

Change-Id: I9cfdbca4986ee6da1e8c42bc0b4477d7d0cb5041
Closes-bug: #1599688
Signed-off-by: Xuanzhou Perry Dong <oss_xzdong@163.com>

commit_message:
Enable placement section on controller in multinode setup

Currently placement api section will be configured on controller
only if service n-cpu is running. It breaks multi node setup.
Closes-Bug: #1667219

(cherry picked from commit f58b37356323262d9ce22815a4cf4e129195c679)

subject: L3 applications to dispatch packets and not send them
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-25 11:44:01.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l3_proactive_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py'], 'message': 'L3 applications to dispatch packets and not send them

In the case of ICMP responding, both L3 applications reply by constructing the packet,
and then sending it to the source using send_packet. This sends the new
packet directly out the ofport.

This change makes the applications return the packet using dispatch_packet,
which has the pipeline dispatch it as a regular packet via the dispatch
tables. This means that in the future, when ports will share ofports (e.g.
in the case of VLAN aware VMs), the tagged port will get the ICMP packet,
and not the parent port.

Change-Id: I31d9c4d91d7917896e79c19f81a0322ab0df3c31
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk
'}]
commit_message:
L3 applications to dispatch packets and not send them

In the case of ICMP responding, both L3 applications reply by constructing the packet,
and then sending it to the source using send_packet. This sends the new
packet directly out the ofport.

This change makes the applications return the packet using dispatch_packet,
which has the pipeline dispatch it as a regular packet via the dispatch
tables. This means that in the future, when ports will share ofports (e.g.
in the case of VLAN aware VMs), the tagged port will get the ICMP packet,
and not the parent port.

Change-Id: I31d9c4d91d7917896e79c19f81a0322ab0df3c31
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk

commit_message:
Tox test should respect upper-constraints

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt
specified version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you
are out on the bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some
python library in the world changes in a way that you don't expect.

Change-Id: Id2d74df90984644e857377bfe83f5c6197dd5c94

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-01 20:10:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/man/nova-manage.rst'], 'message': "doc: add some detail to the map_cell0 man page

There are two changes here:

1. Removes the mention of the message queue since the cell0
   mapping has a transport_url but it's effectively none meaning
   we don't use RPC for accessing cell0 objects.
2. Adds boilerplate wording on the config option used to determine
   the database connection if the --database_connection argument
   is not specified. This was particularly confusing at one point
   because it originally started out as the CONF.api_database.connection
   but we changed that mid-cycle in Ocata since the schema for cell0
   is the cell (nova) DB, not the nova_api DB.

Change-Id: Ie869f8565460600da767d99e9e397abc5e8bf0e0
"}]
commit_message:
doc: add some detail to the map_cell0 man page

There are two changes here:

1. Removes the mention of the message queue since the cell0
   mapping has a transport_url but it's effectively none meaning
   we don't use RPC for accessing cell0 objects.
2. Adds boilerplate wording on the config option used to determine
   the database connection if the --database_connection argument
   is not specified. This was particularly confusing at one point
   because it originally started out as the CONF.api_database.connection
   but we changed that mid-cycle in Ocata since the schema for cell0
   is the cell (nova) DB, not the nova_api DB.

Change-Id: Ie869f8565460600da767d99e9e397abc5e8bf0e0

commit_message:
Add bashate support

Bashate is a style checker program for bash scripts.  This addition
improves the quality of the current bash scripts and ensures that
any future change will follow the same standards.

fetch dynamic vendordata. Add an option to do that.

commit_message:
Add __init__ to run ostestr for the dir

It looks like we need packaging (i.e. __init__.py) for each test dir
otherwise the tests in the dirs is not running on the tox (our gate
too!).

And fix some broken import from package refactoring.

Trivial-Fix

subject: DHCP App to use unique_key and not ofport
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-25 03:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/df_base_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/dhcp_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_dhcp_app.py'], 'message': 'DHCP App to use unique_key and not ofport

Currently, the DHCP application uses the ofport to identify a port. This
will break if ports share an ofport, as in the case of VLAN aware VMs.

This change has DHCP application recognise a logical port by reg6, which
is set to that ports unique key in the classification app. Different ports
will have different unique IDs. The output is also modifies to re-send
the packet by dispatching it using the unique_key, rather than the ofport.

This assumes that the dispatch mechanism knows what to do, which is as
it should be.

Change-Id: I886e41659cfbdf98e1967ec59d14523f0506699e
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk
'}]
commit_message:
DHCP App to use unique_key and not ofport

Currently, the DHCP application uses the ofport to identify a port. This
will break if ports share an ofport, as in the case of VLAN aware VMs.

This change has DHCP application recognise a logical port by reg6, which
is set to that ports unique key in the classification app. Different ports
will have different unique IDs. The output is also modifies to re-send
the packet by dispatching it using the unique_key, rather than the ofport.

This assumes that the dispatch mechanism knows what to do, which is as
it should be.

Change-Id: I886e41659cfbdf98e1967ec59d14523f0506699e
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk

commit_message:
Drop localrc references

devstack-gate supports local.conf over localrc now:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326585/

This broke our tempest check, so dropping the only element filling
localrc file (sourcing devstackgaterc is needed all the time anyway to
get the DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX variable)

Change-Id: I9ee5e18cc5c879de500517e9c663ce99d01218d6
Closes-Bug: 1667485

commit_message:
Fix filter invalid ofport for topology

when ovs port offline, it will have the ovs port update event which
contains the ofport -1, but in current logic the useless event will pass
to df_local_controller and print the unnecessary error log.

Change-Id: Ifc76efa5188f32dc4510f8c6e35516043a8b1d28
Closes-bug: #1667607

commit_message:
pbr.version.VersionInfo needs package name (oslo.xyz and not oslo_xyz)

 We need to pass into VersionInfo what one would expect from running:
 setup.py --name

 Right now we pass in say oslo_context and pbr fails if there is no .git in
  the python source tree

  Closes-Bug: #1662266

Change-Id: I0e4e20a91b640c21f9ee008dc6cf4055d40bc4d5

subject: Add in support for removeKey
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-05 19:13:12.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_vmware/service.py'], 'message': 'Add in support for removeKey

When setting a removeKey the VC would return an error indicating that it
"Unable to determine type of Any". We need to update this to ensure that
the type set is a string or an integer. This is due to the fact that it
can be both.

Change-Id: I494a1d19341f30f22803a3fe6baf020a67ad6b08
'}]
commit_message:
Add in support for removeKey

When setting a removeKey the VC would return an error indicating that it
"Unable to determine type of Any". We need to update this to ensure that
the type set is a string or an integer. This is due to the fact that it
can be both.

Change-Id: I494a1d19341f30f22803a3fe6baf020a67ad6b08

subject: Default chain parameters per parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-24 14:12:59.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/extensions/sfc.py'], 'message': "Default chain parameters per parameter

Make each chain parameter have its own default value.

With this change, if the user creates a chain that specifies only the
'correlation' parameter, the 'symmetric' parameter will still be added,
and vice-versa. This allows the code to make more assumptions about
the definition of the chain, and the tests to be less specific about
the chains they want to simulate.

Change-Id: Idf1052e6bec92aad953e61542671316dff371b78
"}]
commit_message:
Default chain parameters per parameter

Make each chain parameter have its own default value.

With this change, if the user creates a chain that specifies only the
'correlation' parameter, the 'symmetric' parameter will still be added,
and vice-versa. This allows the code to make more assumptions about
the definition of the chain, and the tests to be less specific about
the chains they want to simulate.

Change-Id: Idf1052e6bec92aad953e61542671316dff371b78

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-01 13:56:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py'], 'message': "placement-api: fix ResourceProviderList query

The ResourceProviderList query use groupby without all grouped columns.
This works on mysql with unpredicable result, but don't for other RDBMS.

For example, postgresql gating jobs dsvm that use nova are currently
broken.

This change removes the unused consumer_id on first query,
and uses the primary key 'id' instead of 'uuid' the second groupby.
(Because groupby in postgresql requires a PK or all non-primary columns)

The fix is tested by gate-ceilometer-dsvm-tempest-plugin-postgresql-ubuntu-xenial job
here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427668/

closes-bug: #1660959
Change-Id: I6cc93ba0dd569d56696c9210d38dd2d77b4157c1
"}]
commit_message:
placement-api: fix ResourceProviderList query

The ResourceProviderList query use groupby without all grouped columns.
This works on mysql with unpredicable result, but don't for other RDBMS.

For example, postgresql gating jobs dsvm that use nova are currently
broken.

This change removes the unused consumer_id on first query,
and uses the primary key 'id' instead of 'uuid' the second groupby.
(Because groupby in postgresql requires a PK or all non-primary columns)

The fix is tested by gate-ceilometer-dsvm-tempest-plugin-postgresql-ubuntu-xenial job
here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427668/

closes-bug: #1660959
Change-Id: I6cc93ba0dd569d56696c9210d38dd2d77b4157c1

commit_message:
Use project_id instead of tenant_id

As we moved from tenant_id to project_id, some parts of code still
have both or just old tenant_id. for oslo versioned most of object are
using project_id, This patch replaces it in db_base_plugin_v2.py.

Change-Id: Id44543ae3970afb09951dc05d30eae6cebd096b5

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-11 16:59:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py'], 'message': "Removed vpn tempest mappings breaks vpnaas tests

The 'tox -e api' tests for neutron-vpnaas fail.  The code
relies on the neutron tempest network client and the relevant
service_resource_prefix_map, and the mappings for resources
like:
'vpnservices': 'vpn',
were removed.  This causes the tests to fail with 404 errors
using an incorrect uri.

Adding the mappings back for now to enable tests to run.

Closes-Bug: #1546786
Change-Id: I6d657e2ccb30c1865e15abf80410d7abb944731d
"}]
commit_message:
Removed vpn tempest mappings breaks vpnaas tests

The 'tox -e api' tests for neutron-vpnaas fail.  The code
relies on the neutron tempest network client and the relevant
service_resource_prefix_map, and the mappings for resources
like:
'vpnservices': 'vpn',
were removed.  This causes the tests to fail with 404 errors
using an incorrect uri.

Adding the mappings back for now to enable tests to run.

Closes-Bug: #1546786
Change-Id: I6d657e2ccb30c1865e15abf80410d7abb944731d

commit_message:
Add BaremetalMechanismDriver driver.

When Ironic hypervisor is used, instances live on dedicated hardware
servers. With flat network binding is not needed, since servers
are pre-plugged to the network.
This patch adds BaremetalMechanismDriver that perform fake port binding
for ports in flat networks with vnic_type=baremetal.
Fake binding is needed to move port to ACTIVE state.

Change-Id: I99602a59270406179a1a56777dd7ca98e8d626fb
Related-Bug: #1599836
Related-Bug: #1610898

commit_message:
Fixes failover issue with neutron dns integration

Neutron has added and removed [1] the dns integration extension
as enabled by default.  This patch tells Octavia to check the
neutron extension list to see if the dns integration extension
is enabled before preparing a neutron port for failover and formating
the request appropriately.

(Cherry-picked from: 4f208c3dc2c7a1b3d6e4ad14e17ac8ce5abcb940)
Closes-Bug: #1597451
Change-Id: I15f7cb50642616f87fc8fb5bcb2af1c2e849264d

commit_message:
Move locked mode queries to objects/ports

As we are adopting OVO, and object for port is ready.
This patch move locked mode queries method for port
and binding to be accessed via Port and PortBinding
objects.

Change-Id: I49af05a3964d2e9731662085c3072dcac191e557
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Remove blank 'rules' line for 'neutron qos-policy-show' command
while other fields than rules were Specified using '-F' parameter

commit_message:
libvirt: fix nova can't delete the instance with nvram

Currently libvirt needs a flag when deleting an VM with a nvram file,
without which nova can't delete an instance booted with UEFI. Add
deletion flag for NVRAM. Also add a test case.

Co-authored-by: Derek Higgins <derekh@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I46baa952b6c3a1a4c5cf2660931f317cafb5757d
Closes-Bug: #1567807

subject: SG App to match by reg6 instead of in_port
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-24 19:46:44.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_sg_flows.py', 'dragonflow/controller/sg_app.py'], 'message': 'SG App to match by reg6 instead of in_port

Currently, the SG application uses in_port to
indentify from where the packets are originally from.
This will break if ports share an in_port, as in the
case of VLAN aware VMs.

This change has SG application recognise the source of
connection by by reg6, which is set to that ports unique
key in the classification app. Different ports will have
different unique IDs.

Change-Id: I93eace80f62032b44b591fb34bb1e54006b51372
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk
'}]
commit_message:
SG App to match by reg6 instead of in_port

Currently, the SG application uses in_port to
indentify from where the packets are originally from.
This will break if ports share an in_port, as in the
case of VLAN aware VMs.

This change has SG application recognise the source of
connection by by reg6, which is set to that ports unique
key in the classification app. Different ports will have
different unique IDs.

Change-Id: I93eace80f62032b44b591fb34bb1e54006b51372
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-trunk

This commit addresses multiple potential vulnerabilities in
Magnum. It makes the following changes:

* Permissions for /etc/sysconfig/heat-params inside Magnum
  created instances are tightened to 0600 (used to be 0755).
* Certificate retrieval is modified to work without the need
  for a Keystone trust.
* The cluster's Keystone trust id is only passed into
  instances for clusters where that is actually needed. This
  prevents the trustee user from consuming the trust in cases
  where it is not needed.
* The configuration setting trust/cluster_user_trust (False by
  default) is introduced. It needs to be explicitely enabled
  by the cloud operator to allow clusters that need the
  trust_id to be passed into instances to work. Without this
  setting, attempts to create such clusters will fail.

Please note, that none of these changes apply to existing
clusters. They will have to be deleted and rebuilt to benefit
from these changes.

(cherry picked from commit e93d82e8b3bc19211efd54edc17aebdca50670c1)

Changes for backport:

* Moved cluster_user_trust setting to magnum/common/keystone.py

* Fixed unit tests with configuration overrides.

Change-Id: I408d845ee4fd00d5bcd1e90f0a78f2bba3f2a57a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CVE-2016-7404

This commit addresses multiple potential vulnerabilities in
Magnum. It makes the following changes:

* Permissions for /etc/sysconfig/heat-params inside Magnum
  created instances are tightened to 0600 (used to be 0755).
* Certificate retrieval is modified to work without the need
  for a Keystone trust.
* The cluster's Keystone trust id is only passed into
  instances for clusters where that is actually needed. This
  prevents the trustee user from consuming the trust in cases
  where it is not needed.
* The configuration setting trust/cluster_user_trust (False by
  default) is introduced. It needs to be explicitely enabled
  by the cloud operator to allow clusters that need the
  trust_id to be passed into instances to work. Without this
  setting, attempts to create such clusters will fail.

Please note, that none of these changes apply to existing
clusters. They will have to be deleted and rebuilt to benefit
from these changes.

(cherry picked from commit e93d82e8b3bc19211efd54edc17aebdca50670c1)

Changes for backport:

* Moved cluster_user_trust setting to magnum/common/keystone.py
* Resolved merge conflicts.
* Fixed unit tests with configuration overrides.

Change-Id: I408d845ee4fd00d5bcd1e90f0a78f2bba3f2a57a

commit_message:
Disable TelemetryNotificationAPITest

ceilometer-api is being deprecated, so we want to stop running the tests
and move forward with Gnocchi tests, with auto-scaling (coming in future
patches).

Removing TelemetryNotificationAPITest that is not a valid use case
anymore when using Gnocchi.

Change-Id: I0e09dea793e86a6be40a2ccc4715a1dc9794713e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 05:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v2_validation.py', 'keystone/assignment/schema.py'], 'message': 'Fix v2 role create schema validation

Currently, creating a new role using the v2 api no longer allows
spaces in the role description.  This patch set changes the
schema type, and also fixes a bug in the v2 validation test where
the validation is performed against the v3 schema instead of v2.

Co-Authored-By: Gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I858005c7805ba87f506933d49715cc3ce0d539e1
Closes-Bug: #1667367
'}]
commit_message:
Fix v2 role create schema validation

Currently, creating a new role using the v2 api no longer allows
spaces in the role description.  This patch set changes the
schema type, and also fixes a bug in the v2 validation test where
the validation is performed against the v3 schema instead of v2.

Co-Authored-By: Gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I858005c7805ba87f506933d49715cc3ce0d539e1
Closes-Bug: #1667367

commit_message:
gate-hook: Accomodate devstack-gate local.conf changes

With devstack-gate switching to local.conf we can no longer use bash for
evaluating settings variables. Also we shouldn't populate local.conf
directly and let devstack-gate do that.

Since functional/fullstack jobs are not deployed by devstack-gate, we
need to dump the contents of local.conf file stored in
DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG ourselves before calling to ./stack.sh.

Co-Authored-By: Dariusz Smigiel <smigiel.dariusz@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>

Ocata changes: since we don't deploy services for functional and
fullstack jobs using ./stack.sh, we don't need to produce a local.conf
file either.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh
	neutron/tests/contrib/hooks/api_dvrskip_extensions
	neutron/tests/contrib/hooks/api_extensions

Change-Id: Ie8e94c1a24c81a957546f48531b222117cf65a5b
Closes-bug: 1667331
(cherry picked from commit 65bc6eefe35e1f78f79e796db2bca58daf957d1e)
(cherry picked from commit 4c0768773f88f95253ee577e458a88c4851d720d)

With devstack-gate switching to local.conf we can no longer use bash to
evaluate settings variables. Also we shouldn't populate local.conf
directly and let devstack-gate do that.

Since functional/fullstack jobs are not deployed by devstack-gate, we
need to dump the contents of local.conf file stored in

commit_message:
gate-hook: always write out [[localrc]] line for local.conf rc hooks

This will make the order of hook application irrelevant. By doing that,
it also fixes scenario jobs that were not getting the Ubuntu image
applied.

While at it, the patch partially reverts
Ie8e94c1a24c81a957546f48531b222117cf65a5b to get the script closer to
its previous version. This should help when we backport the two patches
into stable branches.

Change-Id: Id771d4e7bb5bf140ebbc87fca48baf73afb31db4
Closes-bug: 1667331

commit_message:
gate-hook: Accomodate devstack-gate local.conf changes

With devstack-gate switching to local.conf we can no longer use bash for
evaluating settings variables. Also we shouldn't populate local.conf
directly and let devstack-gate do that.

Since functional/fullstack jobs are not deployed by devstack-gate, we
need to dump the contents of local.conf file stored in
DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG ourselves before calling to ./stack.sh.

Co-Authored-By: Dariusz Smigiel <smigiel.dariusz@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>

Ocata changes: since we don't deploy services for functional and
fullstack jobs using ./stack.sh, we don't need to produce a local.conf
file either.

Change-Id: Ie8e94c1a24c81a957546f48531b222117cf65a5b
Closes-bug: 1667331
(cherry picked from commit 65bc6eefe35e1f78f79e796db2bca58daf957d1e)

commit_message:
Correct a policy rule example which reference to nova

This patch corrects the policy rule example. In nova, the policy
enforcement by user_id isn't supported by servers resource, so correct
it to use project_id. Also in the Nova V2.1 API, the new policy rule
for servers start action prefix with 'os_compute_api:servers'.

Closes-Bug: #1666167

Change-Id: Ic6b40e402e253b4a406b77169061736eceaf5102
(cherry picked from commit 1e846b0df83048b2009655a812d44a85eb900234)

commit_message:
Correct a policy rule example which reference to nova

This patch corrects the policy rule example. In nova, the policy
enforcement by user_id isn't supported by servers resource, so correct
it to use project_id. Also in the Nova V2.1 API, the new policy rule
for servers start action prefix with 'os_compute_api:servers'.

Change-Id: Ic6b40e402e253b4a406b77169061736eceaf5102

To support traceroute or its backend network functionality, some icmp
messages are generated or re-processed at local controller. This
provides the possiblity of DDoS attack.

To prevent that, several global rate limters are added. So that the
controller won't be overwhelmed. Global rate limters should be enough,

commit_message:
Add rate limiter to icmp handler(L3 proactive app)

To support traceroute or its backend network functionality, some icmp
messages are generated or re-processed at local controller. This
provides the possiblity of DDoS attack.

To prevent that, several global rate limters are added. So that the
controller won't be overwhelmed. Global rate limters should be enough,
as icmp works as control message.

Change-Id: I2d588a7db246bce4bef8e4f32a4fdd0dfb14384d
Implements: blueprint traceroute-support

subject: Upgrade nova-api/scheduler/conductor packages at step3 not step2.

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-24 21:51:26.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-scheduler.yaml', 'puppet/services/nova-conductor.yaml', 'puppet/services/README.rst', 'puppet/services/nova-api.yaml'], 'message': 'Upgrade nova-api/scheduler/conductor packages at step3 not step2.

The nova-api, nova-scheduler nova-conductor packages are updated during
step2.  The package upgrade trigger a restart of the service which fails
and is constantly retried by systemd:

    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Failed to start OpenStack Nova Scheduler Server.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Unit openstack-nova-scheduler.service entered failed state.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: openstack-nova-scheduler.service failed.

We eventually reach timeout.  We use

Change-Id: I13b51bcfe0c98034944613f7e1c3f0168cd4de76

commit_message:
Upgrade nova-api/scheduler/conductor packages at step3 not step2.

The nova-api, nova-scheduler nova-conductor packages are updated during
step2.  The package upgrade trigger a restart of the service which fails
and is constantly retried by systemd:

    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Failed to start OpenStack Nova Scheduler Server.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: Unit openstack-nova-scheduler.service entered failed state.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: openstack-nova-scheduler.service failed.
    Feb 24 12:34:24 centos-7-2-node-rax-iad-7463943-440549 systemd[1]: openstack-nova-scheduler.service holdoff time over, scheduling restart.

We eventually reach timeout.  We use
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/services/tripleo-packages.yaml#L44-L46
to upgrade existing packages.

Add a note to the README.rst to make people aware of the general upgrade
done at step3 and limit its usage to new package for individual service.

Change-Id: I13b51bcfe0c98034944613f7e1c3f0168cd4de76
Closes-Bug: #1667728
(cherry picked from commit 5593877817b332bd7a650f051cff5f5988ab1e54)

commit_message:
Put correct Etag and Accept-Ranges in EC 304 and 416 responses

When using an EC policy, 304 responses to conditional GETs
are missing the Accept-Ranges header and have the wrong ETag
value. 412 responses also have the wrong etag.

416 responses to ranged GETs also have the wrong ETag.

This patch ensures behaviour with EC policy is consistent
with replication policy:

  - 304 and 416 responses have correct etag and Accept-Ranges
  - 412 responses have correct Etag but no Accept-Ranges

Co-Authored-By: Mahati Chamarthy <mahati.chamarthy@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1496234
Closes-Bug: #1558197
Closes-Bug: #1558193
Change-Id: Ic21317b9e4f632f0751133a3383eb5487379e11f

commit_message:
Refactor rpc backend vhost creation

The creation of the cellsv1 rpc vhost was buried in the restart function,
which makes it hard to extend. This breaks it out into a helper method
and moves the conditional logic into the nova module itself.

Change-Id: Ib0e377aabe45c27bb6ce59ca275ce73085e8b9d2

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-22 10:07:21.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/utils/openstack/manila.py'], 'message': 'Fixing manila microversion setting in sahara.conf

When setting manila microversion in sahara.conf, there is
an exception: api_version is not valid: invalid literal for
int() with base 10.Reason is the type of api_version is set to int in
sahara/utils/openstack/manila.py - Changing it to string fixes it.
and then we can set microversion like 2.2 in the sahara.conf.
Closes-Bug:#1664825

Change-Id: I588dd93a0ee2efb3f311a5e7d42a8a03176f877c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing manila microversion setting in sahara.conf

When setting manila microversion in sahara.conf, there is
an exception: api_version is not valid: invalid literal for
int() with base 10.Reason is the type of api_version is set to int in
sahara/utils/openstack/manila.py - Changing it to string fixes it.
and then we can set microversion like 2.2 in the sahara.conf.
Closes-Bug:#1664825

Change-Id: I588dd93a0ee2efb3f311a5e7d42a8a03176f877c
